We pride ourselves on offering a workplace with a supportive, driven, flexible and inclusive culture. Which is why we’ve been accredited as a Great Place to Work for the last three years running, and listed as one of Australia’s Best Places to Work for 2023.  Here’s a taste of just some of our perks:  Quarterly bonus scheme Two free pairs of glasses each year On-site free parking Birthday leave, Volunteer leave and Paid Parental Leave Health & Wellbeing programs Fully funded social club – provides a wide range of activities throughout the year   So, if you like the sound of working for a company that’s dedicated to improving the lives of both their staff and customers – we think you’d look good at Specsavers.   The Role  The role is part of the project that is responsible for delivering the implementation of an upgraded technology infrastructure, WMS system and order management system across our warehouses and MGS Lab.   Responsibilities include:  Process  Work with warehouse management to capture and document workflow charts and diagrams of the current business processes and supporting systems/applications Work closely with warehouse team to support end-to-end project implementation from planning, assessment, to execution stage Supporting documentation and analysis, ensuring the outputs and objectives are delivered by IT into the system Help identify requirements of the warehouse by identifying substandard systems processes through evaluation of real-time data  UAT  Act as the quality gateway working with the project team to scope and plan UAT to ensure the system implementation proceeds successfully with no detrimental impact upon the operation Support develop of UAT scripts, test plans, acceptance test cases, test scripts that are aligned to the business processes to validate the system is fit for purpose Responsible for the planning and management of the delivery of the User Acceptance Testing, ensuring defects or issues identified are resolved by IT and re-tested  Data & Reporting  Work closely with stakeholders to ensure the data attributes are understood and data requirements documented Responsible for the collection, cleansing and validation of the relevant data sets/files for each system and phase of the project: systems testing, UAT, training and go live Develop the processes that automate conversation of raw data into system load templates Provide feedback on reports for Supply Chain, and to assist with Early Life Support (ELS) the transition into BAU.   Skills we are looking for  Proficient in Excel Experience of using and implementing Warehouse management systems Practical experience generating process documentation, reports & analysis Experience with data visualisation via tools such as SQL and Power BI Strong communication skills  About Us  Specsavers are rated the market leader for eye tests, the retailer of choice for contact lenses and one of the fastest growing hearing providers in Australia and New Zealand. We are on a continual mission to transform eye and hearing health by eliminating preventable vision loss and blindness, including Glaucoma and Diabetes, through improved prevention and early detection, as well as providing accessible and affordable hearing care. Want a high flying career working for the worlds largest air services provider? Join our high performance National Workforce Planning team as a Reporting and Modelling Analyst in a fixed-term (12 months) position based in Melbourne or Sydney. More about this role This position is responsible for the data analysis and reporting of workforce planning and management with core focus of optimising our labour requirements for our national catering business. The role will provide standard and scenario-based reporting including costing models and forecasts for the business versus budget targets. So, what does a day in the life of a Reporting and Modelling Analyst look like? Working closely with the Business Unit Managers and the National Workforce Planning team to ensure that all KPIs are being met. The RMA will provide short term and long term planning solutions, review labour trends on previous workforce plans and provide recommendations on how we can improve the efficiency of the business. The RMA will achieve this through collecting and evaluating data, extracting statistical and analytical data from our systems. In a nutshell, your main responsibilities are: In depth analysis and evaluation of data sets to create reports Using Power BI and Excel to create data models for scenario based Build, develop and implement forecasts and capacity management plans Review of rostering processes, compare pre and post roster publications against completed rosters to identify trends, recommend changes for cost reduction Build and manage business dashboards for WFP Utilise our various WFP software tools for reporting including Groundstar, Human Force and Time Target. Gather feedback from resourcing teams to meet requirements for each business unit in terms of rostering correct operational coverage, staffing ratios and leave planning Develop modelling systems to support the Analytics team in decision making What do you need to be successful in securing this role? Five years demonstrated success in a similar role. Experience in volume data analysis and scheduling/forecasting metrics Tertiary qualifications in Business Analytics, Supply Chain, WFP or related discipline. Exposure to Business Intelligence, Reporting and Dashboards Experience using Power BI for complex modelling and forecasting Experience in Advanced Excel modelling and reporting (SQL and Dbase query) Ability to communicate with all levels of stakeholders Aviation or Food Manufacturing knowledge / experience preferable but not essential. Highly analytical and numerical aptitude with strong problem solving skills Mature reasoning and approach to complex tasks What’s in it for you? Competitive pay rates and penalties. Daily staff meals provided. 5 weeks Annual Leave. Discounts at hundreds of retailers, discounted health insurance and wellbeing resources including online exercise classes. We provide you with training and support to set you up for success in your new role. Your prospective employer: Part of the Emirates Group, we are Australia’s largest inflight catering and retail partner, food manufacturing and retail, travel retail technology, and airport lounge management. Chosen by many of the world’s top airlines, we operate 16 catering facilities across 10 cities, employ over 4,000 people, produce over 64 million meals, and service over 250 thousand flights each year. Job Description Location: Melbourne | Northern Metropolitan Job type: Full time Organisation: Austin Health Salary: Salary not specified Occupation: Administration/Secretarial, Human Resources, Legal, Occupational Health and Safety Reference: 49981 Austin Health is the major provider of tertiary health services, health professional education and research across 3 campuses in the northeast of Melbourne and state-wide. Austin Health is world-renowned for its research and specialist work in cancer, liver transplantation, spinal cord injuries, neurology, endocrinology, mental health and rehabilitation. An exciting opportunity currently exists for an enthusiastic and highly experienced Data Analyst to join our Performance Reporting and Decision Support Department. The Performance Reporting and Decision Support (PRDS) department is responsible for five key areas: Clinical Reporting & Analytics Corporate Reporting Health Information Services (HIS) Data Warehouse Management & Research Analytics Health Information, Reporting & Analytical Projects Clinical Reporting covers all analytical and reporting services for Austin Health in relation to clinical operations. Corporate Reporting oversees clinical costing, funding analytics and corporate reporting. The PRDS division is also responsible for the Austin data warehouses and provision of data to the organisation. HIS consists of medical record scanning, casemix/coding services, submissions of external mandatory activity reporting, corporate records management, morbidity data collection and release of patient information including Freedom of Information. The PRDS division has a staffing of approximately 70 EFT located over three sites. Key responsibilities will include: This role is responsible for supporting Austin Health with their reporting and analytical needs. The Data Analyst will be customer focused and actively engage with all levels of clinical and non-clinical staff. The role will require a detailed understanding of systems, data and information relevant to each clinical or operational area supported and be comfortable providing the business with pro-active, value added insights. You will work with the organisation to deliver key reports and insights to assist in improving effectiveness and efficiency and to assist the organisation to deliver efficient and safe patient care. A client-focused approach is essential to this role and a willingness to engage that involves getting out amongst the business and being a part of their discussions and strategic planning. Working collaboratively within a team of analysts and business partners is essential. To be successful in this role you must demonstrate: Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to liaise at all levels of the organisation Analytical & problem-solving skills with good attention to detail Strong SQL programming skills with demonstrated experience in building complex queries Strong Power BI skills with demonstrated experience in developing meaningful and useful paginated reports and Power BI reports. Strong knowledge with using business intelligence tools and concepts Experience in working with large complex data sets Understanding of data governance Knowledge of Public Health data Experience in health sector reporting Ability to work independently and within a team environment Good organisational, time management, written and verbal skills Tertiary qualifications and/or extensive experience in an appropriate health or business field Desirable but not essential: Tertiary qualifications in Business, Information Technology, Statistics and/or Data Science Experience in using R and/or Python for undertaking data analysis Previous experience in the public health sector Work with us! Your reward is to work in a collaborative environment which will provide you with opportunities for ongoing training and development. Your benefits will include salary packaging, and employee assistance program. All appointments are made subject to a satisfactory National Police Check conducted by Austin Health and if required, a Working With Children Check. Austin Health is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce that reflects the community we serve. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement. Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.  Job Description Sr Data Analyst, Managed Services - 1 year fixed-term Melbourne (Australia) About the role: Do you want to be a part of Visa’s fastest growing team in Australia and New Zealand? Do you enjoy delivering and getting things done? Do you want to make positive impacts for customers and accelerate the pace of innovation in the payments industry? If so, Visa Managed Services (VMS) is the team for you. The VMS team is all about delivery, implementation, and execution. We create squads of delivery consultants to embed within our clients’ organizations to help them deliver better results, faster.’ If you're a Data Analyst who loves data, create insights, solve challenging business problems and want to use your skills for the greater good… then we have the perfect role for you! Why join us: This role will support a key strategic client in Australia helping them deliver on their bank-wide, large-scale simplification agenda. Visa Managed Services is our fastest growing team in Australia and New Zealand – we’ve grown 10x in less than 2 years – and always have fun projects on the horizon to sink our teeth into We get to work with incredible people every day. We’re a team of intrapreneurs who work hard, have fun, and get stuff done. We are a people business where the people are our product. As a result, all our people leaders are 100% dedicated to ensuring a positive employee experience. We attract top talent and are manically focused on developing and retaining that talent at Visa. We are committed to building a diverse team with an inclusive culture that reflects the communities we work in We’re a global company and VMS is a global focus area for Visa. Once established in our Australia team, you’ll have the opportunity to explore roles focused on scaling our VMS business around the world. We support flexible working options and industry leading compensation & benefits. Join us and make a difference today. What you will be doing: Ideally based in Melbourne but with hybrid work options, you will develop and maintain dashboards to understand the performance of various portfolio optimisation initiatives. Your responsibilities will include transforming data for use in creation, maintenance, and automation of the dashboards. You will work closely with the Data Delivery Lead, Product Consultant and Client Portfolio lead to build dashboards, generate insights, solve business problems using customer and transactional data. In this role you will: Explore our clients’ data infrastructure and systems, analyse various datasets, perform data analysis, finding patterns and generating valuable insights to support critical business initiatives and present them back to the business teams. Build dashboards to visualize insights and understand behaviour of customers or understand performance of various portfolio optimisation initiatives. Perform ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions. Producing written communication, visualizations and presentations for leadership and other key stakeholders. What you will bring: Key competencies: Solution-mindset – Applying creative problem-solving techniques and championing a client-first approach to customer insights when opportunities and challenges arise to meet specific business objectives. Active Contributor to Team Success – Strong team orientation with a collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible style. Able to work effectively in a matrixed organization. Tenacity – Self-motivated, results-oriented individual with the ability to progress multiple priorities concurrently. Building Strategic Work Relationships - Excellent client engagement and relationship management skills with a collaborative approach to stakeholder management Driving Execution – Motivated by delivery and with a high attention to detail. What you will need to be successful: Proficient in SQL as an intermediate to advanced level. Experience of working on data platforms like Teradata or GCP is highly preferred. Experience in data visualisation is required, Tableau or QlikSense is highly preferred. Experience in analytics programming languages (e.g., Python) is highly preferred. Advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint and the ability to effectively communicate a story through data (visualisations, storytelling) Experience with GitHub and Confluence is highly preferred. Adept at data crunching, and passionate about unearthing significant patterns and meaningful insights. An eye for accuracy, the ability to self-manage multiple data sets and data requests, and flexibility to respond quickly. You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At Visa a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture, so if you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you. What will also help: High performance delivery focus with a high attention to detail Strong communication skills to make complex concepts accessible for business stakeholders. Ability to influence and collaborate at all levels without relying on hierarchy. Strong team orientation with a collaborative, diplomatic, flexible style and able to work effectively across multiple teams. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Outcome orientated, persistence to challenge the status quo and deliver customer results. A Growth mindset, constantly striving to learn and develop. Excellent client engagement and relationship management skills with a collaborative approach to stakeholder management Innovation minded with high problem-solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor. Self-motivated, results-oriented individual with the ability to progress multiple priorities concurrently. Why Work with us: We are known for offering industry-leading compensation. We have state of the art offices in Melbourne, Sydney, and Auckland We provide world class benefits including: Mental health and wellbeing resources to all employees Generous annual leave plus carers leave, parental leave, baby bonding leave, and pregnancy loss leave, among others Paid volunteering leave & employee referral program cash awards. Ability to work from another location for up to 1 month each year. Global company with global opportunities. We can share endless stories of how we’ve supported our employees to accelerate their career progression and pursue opportunities in other geographies around the world. This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs. You will execute the data governance program vision, promote the role of governance, and develop frameworks to support data governance best practices. In this role you will: Work collaboratively with the business and external agencies to interpret and understand data availability, data ecosystems, data management, and process improvement Plan and develop meaningful and relevant business unit KPIs for the establishment of a data governance practice Implement best practice frameworks and identify opportunities to utilise new and emerging capabilities Support the direction and establishment of a data stewardship capability into broader business platforms across the organisation Define and improve processes for managing data along its lifecycle Design, implement, and manage data-related solutions, utilising various cloud platforms and other technologies About you What you will bring to the role: Experience in a combination of areas related to analytics, data governance, data management, data quality and developing frameworks for organisations Tools: Data Governance platforms, Data platforms, Database Management & Warehouses, Quantitative and qualitative analytical skills Understand the lifecycle of data management from ingestion, usage, and delivery of insights through the use of data by being a conduit to technical and business teams Understand data architectures and frameworks to support data governance initiatives Strong communication and strategic skills to educate, enable, translate and coach best practices in the organisation You must hold (or be willing to obtain) a current Police Check and Working with Children Check What’s to love? Tickets to the Australian Open and Rod Laver Superbox Career development with a range of formal education and on the job training opportunities Health and wellbeing activities through our Thrive program. Onsite gym and tennis facilities. Flexible working practices Free car parking Salary packaging and a range of discounts from our sponsorship partners. distributor in Asia by 30% year on year Analysed past sell-through data and evaluated whether a shop-in-shop opportunity with an Australian department store would be profitable Troubleshooted a non-compliance report and explored an ordering system to understand the issue to ensure the right information is fed through in the future Scoped what work would be required to integrate Bellroy systems with a new partner's sales platform Conducted a monthly sales report, noticed a discrepancy and explored this further Researched retail trends in Asia to understand new opportunities in the region Improved an ordering system process to ensure product data is accurate in our systems Attended a weekly sales meeting and shared an idea of how to optimise a workflow   LOCATION AND HOURS  This Posted 14/11/2023 Job Number 26231 Full/Part Full Time Posting End Date 08/12/2023 Opportunity snapshot:  An exciting, permanent opportunity has become available for a Digital Insights Analyst. The purpose of the Digital Insights Analyst role is to produce ongoing end-to-end customer journey analysis by integrating data from the online and offline platforms. With deep understanding of online/offline data and business context, the role will work closely with the Digital team in providing actionable insights across the BUPA digital estate.  Insights will include (not limited to) recommendations towards optimisation & personalisation hypothesis, conversion improvement opportunities, reporting, dashboard development and ad hoc investigations. The incumbent should be able to synthesize the work of multiple team members into a cohesive result and can translate the complexity of online and offline data into clearly articulated communications.  The role is also responsible for promoting self-service reporting, contributing towards setting the standard for data literacy across the digital team and support the leadership team in fostering a performance mindset across the team. The incumbent keeps track of the latest industry developments in Digital, Data and Analytics to support leading practice within the team.  How will I help?  Integration of digital and enterprise data to perform end-to-end customer journey analysis Proactively assess website traffic and analyse online customer behaviour to provide insights and recommend actions for improvement in the user experience and website conversion. Contribute to support optimisation & personalisation activities through ideation, actionable insights from data, hypotheses generation. Create accessible self-service dashboards and actionable insights that are fact based, intuitive and re-usable. Support the Digital Insights lead in developing an efficient digital analytics ‘factory’ with appropriate balance of automation and deeper bespoke reporting.  What do I need? Demonstrated experience in using web analytics tools and testing tools such as Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics, Adobe Target, Optimisely and a tag management system such as Tealium or Google Tag Manager is a mandatory pre-requisite. Experience in customer data platforms such as Tealium Audience Stream to contribute in the website personalisation activities is desirable Experience in SQL, SAS, R or Python as a scripting language is advantageous. Someone who can not only extract the data but can proactively provide insights and recommended actions for digital optimisation. In other words, you’re a great ‘story teller’.  Key relationships  Customer Data & Analytics Team Digital Team Customer Marketing Team Health Insurance Health Services  What’s in it for me? As well as a competitive salary, a range of Bupa benefits and flexible working/work from home arrangements, you’ll be challenged and encouraged to innovate. You will partner with colleagues who are dedicated to delivering exceptional experiences. We respect and consider everyone, knowing your difference will make the difference. Perk highlights: Discount on our health insurance, travel, car, home, contents and pet insurance products as well as discounts when you attend a Bupa Dental clinic or purchase glasses from a Bupa Optical store.A dedicated internal wellbeing team provides you with a range of services, such as a global resilience program, regular training opportunities on a range of wellbeing topics and access to a variety of wellbeing discounts.An additional well-being day each year to treat yourself. About Bupa Bupa is an international healthcare group which has been committed to a purpose of longer, healthier, happier lives and making a better world for more than 70 years. In Australia and New Zealand, Bupa supports more than 5 million customers through a broad range of health and care services including health insurance, aged care, rehabilitation, dental, optical, medical, hearing, and medical visa services. Be a part of leading customer-centric data analytics projects. Enjoy hybrid working and say YES to more of life's BIG, little moments. Drive high impact company improvements through customer insights & analytics  Our Customer Loyalty team at MFG not only knows our Customers but are passionate about using this data to create an exceptional customer experience. Within our Customer Loyalty team, we are driving exciting initiatives for our customers through mapping and data that provides future learnings of our customers buying behaviour and journey analytics. Our ongoing commitment and investment in developing our knowledge bank and customer insights has led to an opportunity for an experienced Customer Data Analyst to join our Customer Loyalty and CRM team. More about the role; Before we talk about the role; did you know that we have hybrid working (2 days from home - 3 days in the office), we have monthly town hall meetings, table tennis table, free gym, free coffee (really good coffee), life leave (more leave for when you need it), Development Dollars (more investment in you!) an amazing culture - lots of catch ups (usually with cake) and an open, light, collaborative and supportive work place. Well that is only the beginning..... back to this amazing opportunity. Reporting to our Head of Loyalty and CRM this role is all about our customers! From customer lifecycle metrics through to forecasting trends and future buying behaviour, this role focuses on our customers and the ability to identify trends, patterns, and insights from data. Your experience working with high-volume customer data, will lean into developing dashboards around customer-centric data as well as developing our CDP and loyalty platforms. If you are passionate about data analysis and have a love for footwear, then this is the opportunity you have been waiting for. What your day would look like; If you have a keen eye for detail, a knack for uncovering insights, and a drive to make data-driven, customer-centric decisions then read on! As the Customer Data Analyst you will be responsible for;   Analyse customer data to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for growth Conduct indepth analysis of customer behaviour, preferences and purchasing habits Analysing and interpreting customer-related data to derive insights to assist with making informed business decisions for MFG Assisting with data strategy planning to interpret insights and modelling to assist with customer segmentation improvements Develop and maintain customer segmentation models to optimize marketing strategies and loyalty initiatives. Prepare and present key findings and recommendations to stakeholders Developing and monitoring CRM reporting. Leading data governance to ensure best practice in line with Australian and marketing standards.  More about You   We are looking for Customer Data Analyst with experience from a large-scale retail or FMCG environment, with a D2C edge! You will have proven experience in data mining, modelling and visualisation Tertiary qualifications or a background in statistics, maths, economics, or data science 3+ years' experience in CRM or Customer data analytic roles. Ideally, experience in retail/multi-brand environment advantageous. Intermediate understanding of databases (e.g SQL Server, Oracle and SAP (Emarsys)). Experience of reporting & data visualisation tools (e.g. Business Objects, PowerBI and Tableau). A keen understanding of website scripts (e.g. XML, Javascript, JSON). Understanding of ETL framework. Digital marketing analytics tools including Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager and Adobe Marketing Suite. Experience using CDP, ESP and Loyalty platforms to build audiences and extract insights. Strong attention to detail, problem solving and critical thinking skills. Presentation skills – ability to easily communicate complex ideas in a simple manner. Advanced Excel skills with strong mathematical & numeracy skills.  You're not expected to have 100% of these skills. We want you to grow and mature with the rest of the organisation. If you like working with an innovative Customer Loyalty and Analytics team, with visibility of a dynamic organisation, and the opportunity to grow then we invite you to explore this role - we would love to hear from you. More about Us With more than 290+ stores and 2500+ employees nationally and a brand-new state-of-the-art distribution centre, we are Australia's leading retailer and wholesaler of fashion and comfort footwear, owning and operating some of Australia's most iconic brands including Midas, Mollini, Cinori, Mathers, Williams, Diana Ferrari, Bobux and Australia's largest online footwear retailer, Styletread! As a family-owned company, at Munro Footwear Group (MFG) we value our team, our loyal customers, and our dedicated suppliers. We work hard to play hard, we celebrate each other, and we believe every Team Member is an essential part of our ongoing success. Why You Are Going to Love Working At Munro; There has never been a more exciting time to join Munro Footwear Group as we continue to grow! We offer a flexible, friendly, welcoming team environment where continued support, training and generous Team Member benefits are provided, including discounts across all our Brands   Generous employee discount for you and your immediate family! job_title: Senior Data Analyst Audit, Technology, Digital & Data
job_description: Work type: Permanent Full time Region: VIC- Melbourne CBD  Showcase your internal audit and data analysis skills You’ll be supported to manage your career, work and life You’ll be encouraged to experiment and find out where you excel It’s more than a career at NAB. It’s about more opportunity, more moments to make a difference and more focus on you. Your job is just one part of your life. When you bring your ideas, energy, and hunger for growth to us, you’ll be recognised and rewarded for your contribution in return. You’ll have our support to excel for our customers, deliver positive change for our communities and grow your career.  It’s a good time to see what more you can find at NAB as a Senior Analyst within our Internal Audit Finance team specialising in Data Analytics.  The purpose of this role is to deliver high quality and effective Data Analytics to support the planning, execution and reporting of Audit’s Plan delivery.  Responsibilities include, but not limited to:  Responsible for defining the data analytics approach to execute against the hypothesis as defined by the Auditors. Responsible for sourcing relevant datasets, undertaking data preparation and transformation activities and execution of analysis. Responsible for technical and logical QA review on own work and where nominated as peer reviewer. Responsible for interpreting results in context of the business and audit objectives. Effective communication of testing approach and results to technical and non-technical audiences. Form effective working relationships with audit, technology and business contacts during analysis so information can be gathered, and facts verified. Responsible for delivering within agreed timelines, monitoring and managing their own activities and escalating as required in a timely manner. Contribution to Agile huddles as required. Responsible for coaching auditor peers in analytics activity. Provide feedback and coaching to colleagues to promote a performance and development culture. Contribute as agreed to design and execution of strategic DA activities.  What you will bring:  Strong experience in Data Analytics team in Audit, Risk or Assurance functions with subject matter expertise in Technology Operations/Cyber Security and related tools such as CyberArk, ServiceNow, Rally, Splunk, Qualys. Possess numeracy/data and analytical skills for analysis and evaluating outcomes to identify key issues, trends, and themes from large volumes of complex information Strong Microsoft Excel data analysis skills. Ability to write clear and concise instructions for procedures and descriptions of situations, cases, or issues. Advanced SQL, Python and Data visualisation experience (Power BI preferred). Degree or relevant experience in technology, computer science, data science or numerate area.  By joining NAB and our Finance team, you are committing to putting our customers’ needs first every time. You will be ambitious for growth; always curious and learning from colleagues. You will speak honestly, always valuing the time and opinion of others. You will own your work, doing what’s right, even when it’s hard.  A diverse and inclusive workplace works better for everyone. At NAB, we’re intent on building a culture we can all be proud of. One based on trust and respect. An uplifting environment where every single one of us feels appreciated and empowered to be our true, authentic selves. A diverse and inclusive workplace where our differences are celebrated, and our contributions are valued. It’s a huge part of what makes NAB such a special place to be.  More focus on you We’re committed to delivering a positive experience for our colleagues and a workplace you can be proud of. We support our colleagues to balance their careers and personal life through flexible working arrangements such as hybrid working and job sharing and competitive financial and lifestyle benefits. We invest in our colleagues through world class development programs (Distinctive Leadership and Career Qualified in Banking), and empower you to learn, grow and pursue exciting career opportunities. For more information, please click here.  Join NAB If you think this role is the right fit for you, we invite you to apply. If you require any reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process or the role, please let the recruitment consultant know.  To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or Australian permanent residency status. Key Responsibilities  Works on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors. Job Description Location: Melbourne | Western Metropolitan Job type: Full time Organisation: Western Health Salary: Salary not specified Occupation: IT and Telecommunications, Other Reference: 52512 Flexible hybrid work environment Williamstown base 5 weeks annual leave Salary Packaging & monthly ADOs We are seeking to appoint a highly professional, self-motivated individual with well-developed data management and analysis skills to join a high-performing multidisciplinary team of business intelligence and analytic specialists at Western Health. To be Successful in this Role you will have: Relevant tertiary qualification and/or proven success in a similar role Developed skills in the extraction, analysis and reporting of data, with a high level of attention to detail Excellent computer skills including well developed knowledge of MS Office products The ability to manage competing demands with a structured approach to problem resolution Strong interpersonal and communication skills Duties: Manage mandatory reporting processes to ensure deadlines are met and data is of high standard for all allocated datasets (VINAH or VAED) Develop and maintain required processes and initiatives to ensure data errors are prevented from occurring and are kept at a minimal level Develop and maintain a sustainable reconciliation process for responsible datasets, ensuring accuracy and consistency of data between Western Health and the DH Provide guidance to relevant business areas and staff on the reporting requirements, business rules and data quality issues About Us Our workforce of over 11,000 employees are driven by our values of ‘Compassion, Accountability, Respect, Excellence and Safety’ (CARES). The Project Analyst operates as part of the team responsible for inputting all land and building data (usually received as architectural drawings) from over 1,800 school campus sites, comprising an asset portfolio of approximately $20bn. The data is used for a range of program and project related purposes including those relating to relocatable movements, financial reporting, school funding for cleaning, maintenance and essential safety works. The Project Analyst will contribute to the development of strategies and systems designed to facilitate the effective analysis and use of school asset data. The IAU team is responsible for conducting a high volume of work within tight timelines, and communicating with stakeholders on a regular basis. JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.  Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.  Shaping the future of real estate for a better world.  At JLL, we see a Brighter Way forward for our clients, our people, our planet, and our communities. With over 200 years of real estate experience, we are, and always have been, in continual pursuit of brighter ways of working.  We bring to life see a Brighter Way in all that we do by seeking better, smarter, more innovative ways of working. We approach our work in a warmer, more optimistic, and inclusive way.  The Opportunity: The Sustainability Reporting Analyst position is part of JLL’s Sustainability Services team and will see you working on environmental reporting and sustainability-related services across one of Victoria's most significant office accommodation portfolios, spanning over 1M square meters of owned and leased properties on behalf of the State Government.  You will play a key role in delivering JLL’s scope of service, focusing on utilities, energy, emissions, water, and waste. You will be supported by a team of four sustainability professionals and approximately eighty other real estate specialists from Operations, Finance and Real Estate workstreams. You will also be part of a broader sustainability team across JLL comprising over fifty engineers, consultants and reporting specialists Australia-wide.  Working closely with the Sustainable Operations team and the Shared Services Provider (SSP) stakeholders, this role is responsible for the following: Overseeing accurate utility invoice payment approval, billing reconciliation and data capture within the JLL data management systems. Responsibilities include account and aged debt, utility retailer liaison and investigations, ensuring data is maintained to a consistently high standard quality checking and assurance to ensure data can be used for internal and external reporting. Documenting and managing Green Lease Schedule obligations, collating NABERS certificates, associated reporting, and attending building environmental working group meetings as required. Identify and drive waste improvement initiatives with clients, vendors, and the internal account team to reduce waste to landfills and increase recycling rates.  Annual State Government Environmental Reporting Financial Reporting Direction 24: Reporting environmental data by government entities (FRD 24), noting that JLL provides a data and support role only in this process.  Annual JLL Reporting Delivery of site-by-site lease and asset plans summarises environmental performance and outcomes achieved at all our locations in line with contract requirements.  Quarterly reporting Quarterly environmental reporting to SSP and Client Agencies. NABERS Self Assessments for owned buildings. Requests for information from various landlords and other vendors for environmental data.  Monthly reporting, including Adhoc requests Contributing to team reporting requirements Exception reporting identifying high consumption/cost sites, billing errors, etc. Provide ad-hoc reports, as required, including individual site reporting, cost recovery calculations, questionnaires, etc. Manage the processing and validation of utility invoices and the upload of data into a central online platform – JLL Canopy. Troubleshoot issues relating to energy, water and waste billing and consumption anomalies. Contribute to the analysis of energy consumption, costs and efficiency opportunities. Support the account team to analyse the merits of environmental improvement projects by analysing current benchmarks, costs and payback periods to determine the return on investment in support of budget funding requests and business cases.  Key Skills Criteria: Passionate about sustainability with the desire to make a difference. A keen eye for detail and a willingness to learn new skills. Ability to problem solve. Great interpersonal, written and oral communication skills. Listens effectively and communicates through action and example. Proficient in using the MS Office product suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook, particularly Excel, with a knowledge of pivot tables, lookups, and complex formulas. Comfortable working with large datasets and the ability to extract and analyse data into clear and logical reports with particular attention to detail.  Sounds like you, this is what we are looking for: Tertiary qualifications in Sustainability, Environmental Management, Science, Property, Engineering or a related field are desirable but not mandatory. 1-2 years experience working in corporate sustainability, government or sustainability consulting. Demonstrable experience within a similar role will be well regarded.  What you can expect from us: As an organisation, we don't just accept that we are a place of many different people, but we embrace it, we celebrate it, and we proactively support the needs that difference brings.  JLL is committed to equal opportunity and building an inclusive workplace. This is why, for more than a decade, we continue to rank among the World's Most Ethical Companies.  We support applications from all underrepresented groups, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBT+, people with disability and people of all age, religions and race.  We are dedicated to offering veterans from all ranks and services a successful civilian career as they transition out of the military. We recognise and appreciate the skills acquired in their service careers as vital and transferable to our workforce. If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!  Personalized benefits that support personal well-being and growth:  JLL recognizes the impact that the workplace can have on your wellness, so we offer a supportive culture and comprehensive benefits package that prioritizes mental, physical and emotional health.  About JLL –  We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities.  Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.  Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.Show moreReport

Create impactful data visualizations. Collaborate for actionable insights. Drive data-driven decisions.   Job Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst Department: Data Analytics Location: Metro Manila or Melbourne  Job Summary: We are seeking a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our Data Analytics team. BI Analysts are responsible for creating reports, dashboards, and data visualizations that provide actionable insights to non-technical stakeholders. They play a vital role in making data accessible and understandable for non-technical teams, helping our organization make data-driven decisions to improve operations and strategies.  Key Responsibilities: Create and maintain reports, dashboards, and data visualizations for stakeholders to facilitate decision-making. Gather and understand business requirements for data reporting and analysis to meet stakeholders' needs. Collaborate with data analysts and data scientists to access, prepare, and transform data for reporting. Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and track business metrics to measure success and identify areas for improvement. Provide insights and recommendations to improve business processes based on data analysis. Stay up to date with BI tools and best practices to continually enhance reporting capabilities. Train end-users within the organization on how to use BI tools and reports effectively to maximize their utility. Behaviors: Successful BI Analysts should exhibit the following behaviors: Strong business acumen and a deep understanding of the organization's goals and processes. Effective communication skills to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical teams, translating data into actionable insights. Attention to detail in designing and presenting data visualizations that are clear and impactful. Curiosity to explore data for actionable insights, continuously seeking ways to improve reporting. Adaptability to evolving reporting requirements and the ability to pivot as needed. Collaboration with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide meaningful solutions. Effective time management to meet report delivery deadlines consistently. Technical Skills: The ideal candidate will have proficiency in the following technical skills: Expertise in BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, or similar platforms for report and dashboard creation. Data visualization and dashboard design to effectively present data insights. Proficiency in SQL for data querying and retrieval from various data sources. Data cleaning and transformation techniques to ensure data accuracy and reliability. Basic data analysis and statistical skills to uncover meaningful patterns. Knowledge of database systems for efficient data access. Understanding of data security and access controls within BI tools to safeguard sensitive information.Show moreReport

We’ve been trusted to serve Aussie communities since 1914 and grown to become a top 30-listed on the ASX with 120,000 team members and a portfolio of iconic brands. Job Description Our Forensic Team assists clients to detect and respond to fraud, bribery, corruption, money laundering, misconduct and other financial crime issues as well as resolving commercial disputes. We help clients protect their business by aiding where facts and figures do not agree, where behaviour does not comply with expectations or where advice is needed concerning legal and regulatory requirements. By applying forensic techniques, investigation, intelligence, technology and industry skills we can help prevent and resolve commercial disputes, fraud, misconduct, and breaches of rules and regulations. Your Opportunity We have an opportunity in our Melbourne forensic data analytics practice for a manager to assist our clients with calculating compensation arising from errors or misconduct. You will be working with our top tier clients in investigating, quantifying and remediating matters of fraud, misconduct, non-compliance and other irregularities. Your responsibilities will include: Work with leading global organisations, regulators and law firms to formulate and document requirements for identifying, investigating and analysing business processes, functions and control frameworks. Translation of requirements into analytics methodologies and designing data models. Using programming (such as SQL and Python) connect disparate data sources, and develop scripted routines to assist with establishing the facts and identifying irregularities. Quantify the impact of issues by translating business rules and instructions to codified routines. Present findings using dashboards (such as PowerBI and Tableau) to enable exploratory data analysis and insights. Draft clear and concise reports recording assumptions, decisions, methodology and results. Testing and ensuring quality of analysis delivered by team members. Scope and carry out day-to-day management of engagements (budgeting and billing), liaising with clients, assessing and analysing data and documentation, and managing junior team members. Support business development activities, including proposal development. How are you extraordinary? You might be someone coming from a non-technology background (e.g. accounting, investigations, disputes, legal, audit, risk or compliance) looking to grow their technical data analytics skills. You’re a detailed oriented individual with excellent problem solving skills. You may not know the answer now, but you will take the initiative to work it out. You are great with quantitative analysis and have excellent written communication skills to articulate your analysis to a non-technical audience. You are comfortable working in ambiguous situations – we work on projects where historical data may be incomplete or missing, but we still need to develop defensible approaches to challenging business problems. You’re a great project manager and love keeping organised. Your Experience We’re interested in more than just technical skills, we look for potential. How you grow matters to us. We’re looking for people hungry to learn, with an intellectual curiosity that is waiting to be tapped to help solve our client’s biggest challenges. Your skills & experience could include: More than 5 years of professional work experience, preferably as a data analytics consultant, data analyst, SQL developer, business analyst or related role. Strong skills in Microsoft Excel. Experience in analysis with Microsoft SQL (but if you don’t have strong experience in this, we’re keen on understanding what exposure you have and how you will learn). Experience leading small teams, including methodology development, model design, task assignment and quality review. Experience in legal analytics, loss quantification, remediation or wage compliance is ideal but not necessary. Qualifications Tertiary qualifications or work experience in a business discipline (e.g. finance, accounting, law). Tertiary qualifications in a technical discipline (e.g. engineering, IT, computing, information systems) desirable but not mandatory. Must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident of Australia. Additional Information KPMG is a professional services firm with global outreach and deep sector experience. We work with clients across an array of industries to solve complex challenges, steer change and enable growth. Our people are what make KPMG the thriving workplace that it is and what sets us apart is that we know great minds think differently. Collaborate with a team of passionate, highly skilled professionals who’ve got your back. You’ll build relationships with unique and diverse colleagues who will provide you with the support you need to be your best and produce meaningful and impactful work in an inclusive, equitable culture. At KPMG, you’ll take control over how you work. We’re embracing a new way of working in many ways, from offering flexible hours and locations to generous paid parental leave and career breaks. Our people enjoy a variety of exciting perks, including retail discounts, health and wellbeing initiatives, learning and growth opportunities, salary packaging options and more. Diverse candidates have diverse needs. During your recruitment journey, information will be provided about adjustment requests. If you require additional support before submitting your application, please contact the Talent Support Team. At KPMG every career is different, and we look forward to seeing how you grow with us.Show moreReport

Description  Founded by deep AI and data science experts, Data Science Group (DSG) is a global leader in AI technologies, specializing in cutting-edge AI technology solutions as well as AI governance, auditing, monitoring, and performance management solutions. Headquartered in Tel Aviv, Israel, our roots lie deep in the tech business culture of innovation and research, and its translation to tangible business value.  The DSG Australia team is a group of AI and transformation specialists passionate about supporting large businesses through their journey of innovating, scaling, and transforming with AI.  We are continually fuelled by the opportunities to solve some of the most complex issues challenging businesses today as they venture into the ever-evolving age of AI.  As a Data Science and Analytics Consultant at DSG Australia, you will work with clients to design their AI processes and governance procedures, develop innovative solutions to complex business challenges, provide strategic guidance on leveraging data and machine learning technologies to drive business outcomes, and design and implement data-driven solutions. You will be responsible for delivering successful outcomes while maintaining strong relationships with clients and stakeholders.  As DSG Australia grows its footprint in Australia and APAC, this is a great opportunity for you as a data scientist to join a fast-growing start-up and broaden your skills and professional experience.  Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with clients and stakeholders to understand their business challenges and objectives and design data-driven solutions to address them. Provide clients with strategic guidance and leadership on varied data science and analytics topics. This includes leveraging data to drive growth and competitive advantage while reducing operational risk through disciplined AI processes and governance procedures. Lead end-to-end data science and analytics projects, including problem definition, data preparation modelling, and deployment. Build predictive models, conduct statistical analysis, and design experiments to derive insights and inform business decisions. Stay up-to-date with the latest data science techniques and tools and proactively identify opportunities to apply them to client projects. Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure successful delivery of data-driven solutions. Requirements Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree in Data Science, Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field. At least five years of experience in data science, machine learning, and statistical modelling. Strong programming skills in Python. Experience with databases and SQL or other data storage technologies. Experience in delivering ML models into production environments. Proven ability to lead data science projects and deliver successful outcomes for clients. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Deep understanding of corporate AI processes and governance procedures. Passionate about the potential of AI and its business implications. A growth mindset in your approach to your work and career. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Located in Melbourne and eligible to work in Australia. Benefits  If you are a highly skilled and experienced data scientist professional with a track record of delivering data-driven solutions to complex business problems and a passion for providing strategic guidance to clients, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. We offer competitive compensation packages, flexible work practices, a collaborative and inclusive culture, and a focus on our people’s well-being to drive innovation and entrepreneurship.   Only relevant candidates will receive a response.  Show moreReport

JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.  Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.  Shaping the future of real estate for a better world At JLL, we see a Brighter Way forward for our clients, our people, our planet, and our communities. With over 200 years of real estate experience, we are, and always have been, in continual pursuit of brighter ways of working.  We bring to life see a Brighter Way in all that we do by seeking better, smarter, more innovative ways of working. We approach our work in a warmer, more optimistic, and inclusive way. JLL is a global leader in helping clients envision where people will live, work, play, shop, and eat.  What this opportunity involves: The Business Intelligence Analyst’s primary purpose is to support the Work Dynamics accounts business in a client-dedicated role. The analyst will operate in the Work Dynamics Client Operations Enablement Business. With guidance from BI specialists and managers across the region, the analyst will further develop and assess their skills utilising the gamified learning pathways. This role will develop innovative analytical solutions that support the account to improve quality, reduce risk, optimise cost and cut carbon.  The Client Operations Enablement Business has a well-established commitment to continuous learning and innovation and as such the job holder will be expected to embrace the Tableau and Alteryx external communities, to ensure their skills are constantly evolving and they embrace new analytical techniques and functionality within our core BI products.  As the use of data and analytics matures, so will the tools and platforms the firm uses for Business Intelligence. The analyst will be expected to support the development of analytical Proof of Concepts to demonstrate the potential return on investment and then to transform Proof of Concepts into sustainable processes that can be adopted by the account and can be shared across JLL. This will be done as part of the wider Work Dynamics platform ensuring any developed solutions are documented and embedded within the operating framework of the team, including leveraging governed data architecture models.  About the role: The person will be accountable for building effective analytical products and being able to transform transactional data into meaningful business insights to help people see and understand data.  The ideal candidate will be a highly skilled individual, being able to demonstrate concepts for data Giang and analytics, from design thinking through to creative solutions.  In addition, the ideal candidate will demonstrate an ability to embrace new techniques and technology, taking a high-level business requirement and working in partnership with external experts to develop solutions from conceptual models, through to actual proof of concepts and finally sustainable business as usual solutions.  They will be required to work at pace, using agile working methodology that enables an iterative approach to project delivery.  Whilst a strong technical knowledge is essential it is equally important the candidate can be integrated alongside existing staff, both sharing their knowledge with, and learning from, other analysts and specialists on the account and wider across the JLL analytics community.  The candidate will support the account’s vision that;  Data is Governed: Analytical solutions should be based upon data that is defined and documented based upon business rules and consistent ways of working. When solutions are placed into production the underlying data should be transformed to ensure it complies with the account’s Data Architecture strategy; data being defined and structured once through relational models, but then used multiple times through published Tableau Data Sources.  Data is Accessible: Solutions should be accessible to the business users, ensuring the benefits of analytics are realized and a measurable return on investment achieved. Analytics developed by the analyst should be implemented in cooperation with the business partnering or integration teams who will be responsible for supporting the business users to identify actionable business insights from the data.  Operational processes are efficient: Through the knowledge and expertise of the analyst the efficiency of the account’s analytics should be maximized, ensuring dashboards and analytics are developed using industry-leading techniques and constantly referencing best practices identified through the BI community. Solution approaches and underlying design processes must be available across all members of the WD BI and performance teams for peer review and future troubleshooting  Innovative Analytical Techniques are enabled: The use of analytics should always be seeking innovative and new techniques that drive increased efficiency and savings through the effective utilisation of data.  The outcome of the Business Intelligence Analyst should be informed business decisions and planning, based on insightful analytics. Every deliverable of the role should be able to demonstrate a measurable return on investment and improved outcomes for the client.  Sound like the job you are looking for? Before you apply it’s also worth knowing what we are looking for: A BI expert with knowledge of data visualisation and analytical techniques. Global experience and best practices to integrate business processes and ensure effective utilization of data. Proven examples of having utilized Tableau and Alteryx to develop innovative solutions to complex requirements. Demonstrates an ability to learn new techniques and tools, as and when identified, for example, predictive modelling. Communication - Excellent presentation skills (verbal and written), Strong understanding of analytic/statistical concepts with the ability to explain them to others. Strategic Thinking - Ability to think broadly, adopt a shared vision, and embrace change as an opportunity. Client Management - Understanding client needs and setting and managing appropriate client expectations within the system, project, or contract constraints all while providing exceptional customer service, creating trust and transparency which enables integration Team-building -Key stakeholders and collaborators are geographically dispersed. Getting results from ad hoc groups of disparate people is critical. Experience of agile methodology. Introduction: About Cann Group Limited  Cann Group Limited is enhancing patients’ lives by developing, producing, and supplying innovative cannabis medicines. The Company has built world-class research, cultivation and GMP manufacturing facilities in Melbourne, and a state-of-the-art large-scale cultivation and GMP manufacturing facility near Mildura, Victoria. Cann Group supplies a range of dried flower and oil products, as well as active pharmaceutical ingredients and extracts, to customers in Australia and around the world. Cann Group also owns Satipharm and its patent-protected capsule technology. Learn more at: www.canngrouplimited.com | www.satipharm.com  Position Summary  The IT Business Analyst will be responsible for driving innovation and efficiency through business software applications and solutions to Cann Group users and ensure our ERP system aligns seamlessly with our business objectives. The role will encompass system administration, reporting, and process design to align with business needs to achieve quality, consistency and required business outcomes.  We are looking for an experienced IT Business Analyst with a strong focus on ERP administration to join our dynamic team at Cann Group.  Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities  Take ownership of our ERP system, overseeing its day-to-day operations, maintenance, and troubleshooting. Possess a solid understanding of Procurement, Sales, and Finance processes, a familiarity with Manufacturing and Distribution would be highly regarded. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements, gather user feedback, and identify opportunities for process improvements and automation within the ERP system. Understand reporting requirements and data structure of ERP data to be able to assist in developing reports and data models in BI reporting tool. Utilise your technical expertise to configure, customize, and optimise the ERP system to meet specific business needs. Work closely with vendors and developers when necessary. Document system processes/system SOPs and workflows. Create test scenarios and acceptance criteria artefacts by carefully reviewing and understanding user requirements. Test and validate system prior to user acceptance testing and showcase to stakeholders. Participate and support business users in user acceptance testing to ensure overall efficiency functionality and user-friendliness of the system enhancement/developments are achieved. Work closely with application vendors on a daily basis to ensure efficient solutions are implemented. Prepare training material for end-users on how to use the system. Provide training to end-users on ERP system functionality, features, and best practices. Offer ongoing support and resolve user issues and inquiries. Maintain comprehensive documentation of system configurations, processes, and user guides to facilitate knowledge sharing and ensure compliance with company policies and industry standards. Build strong relationships with vendors to ensure maximum benefit for solutions. Build strong relationships with end users to provide effective business outcomes. Contribute to the Information Technology teams success by working collaboratively across the business in assisting team members when needed, sharing ideas, knowledge, and experience. Actively contribute to Cann Groups risk aware culture and performance through participating in operational risk training and adhering to relevant compliance and regulatory obligations.  Person Specification  Qualifications / Licences  Tertiary or Diploma qualifications in IT, Business Systems, or similar field. Current Victorian Drivers Licence. Pre-employment Health & Security Checks.  Experience  Experience with a Distribution and Manufacturing modules in an ERP system is a must. Experience with Sage ERP is an advantage. Experience in understanding business data in ERP and have the ability to develop reports in BI tool. Experience in Pharma/Biotech or similarly regulated environment highly regarded.  Skills / Competencies  Strong ability to converse with both end-users and IT employees at all levels of the organisation. Basic understanding of all aspects of system/software development life cycle. Strong interpersonal and influencing skills and the ability to develop collaborative relationships across the organisation. Strong stakeholder management skills. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. We know that circumstances can create barriers to learning, so we offer our students personalised pathways, flexible study options and learning support.   About the role:  As a member of the Product, Analytics and Data Science (PADS) team, you will be responsible for working with stakeholders across the organisation to solve critical business challenges. This role will see the elicitation of user requirements for building business intelligence, performance monitoring and reporting solutions. You will be an expert in open-ended problem solving and getting to the root cause of issues based on evidence. You will also be adept at bridging the gap between business users and technical teams. As part of a high performing and supportive team, you will have the ability to collaborate on a range of analytical and strategic initiatives. You will enjoy working autonomously and have a high tolerance for working in ambiguity.   Duties: Engaging heavily with business stakeholders to define, document and provide recommendations for end-to-end business intelligence assets, eliciting requirements, covering data source & lineage, metrics & measures and user experience. Lead or participate in multiple enterprise level projects, applying agile project management methodologies to achieve organisation goals, including preparing project charters, supplying reports and identifying, mitigating and escalating risks. Applying open-ended problem-solving skills for the development and facilitation of stakeholder interviews, workshops and surveys to translate into user scenarios, KPI’s and solution specifications. Act as a bridge between business users and technical teams, including external suppliers, by simplifying information so it is easily understood by all stakeholders.   Skills and experience required: Tertiary degree in a field including Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or similar. Minimum of 2 years experience in a similar role working on analytic, business intelligence or reporting initiatives. Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills including demonstrated ability to communicate complex analytical and process concepts with confidence and in an accessible way. High-level open-ended problem-solving skills and ability to work autonomously in a complex environment with competing priorities. job_description: Job Description Location: Melbourne | CBD Job type: Full time Organisation: Victorian Legal Services Board and Commissioner Salary: $116,552 - $127,621 Occupation: Technology Reference: VG/1754290 Flexibility – Culture – Well-being – Partnership – Purpose Can you tell me more about what you do at VLSB+C?  Great question! We're really proud of the work we do. We are the regulator of the Victorian legal profession. We license lawyers and oversee service standards and conduct. This includes handling complaints about lawyers, investigating poor conduct and overseeing management of trust accounts. We are also the stewards of the public purpose and fidelity funds and administer these to support legal regulation and access to justice in Victoria.  We are a modern best practice regulator, using data and insights to help identify where our actions can have the greatest impact on ensuring ethical and professional legal practice by Victorian lawyers. We are passionate about maintaining and protecting the rule of law by ensuring the integrity of the legal profession.  What role are you recruiting for?  We're looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Data & Insights Team. You will focus on providing technical expertise in statistical and data analytics to increase the efficiency and accuracy of regulatory, compliance, and educational programs.  What type of person are you looking for?  We are looking for candidates with the following  Relevant qualification in information technology, S.T.E.M., statistics, data science / business analysticsor economics / econometrics or relevant experience Experience in data analytics methodologies, techniques and analytics software Experience in programming languages, statistical, data visualisation programs and reporting software  How are you different from other organisations?  We offer:  Flexibility: We have work leading edge flexible working options including part-time, compressed hours, flexible start time, up to 3 days working from home. Culture: Our culture results are better than the wider VPS by an average of 10% Well-being: We have an active Social Club and Health and Wellbeing Committee that promote fun and engaging activities throughout the year Partnership: our horizontal structure allows for more partnership with your colleagues and other teams Purpose: We play a key role in regulating the legal practice in Victoria  I want to know more!  Alex Codoreanu would love to hear from you on 03 7039 8407 if you have questions about the role.  I'm now really interested!  Our recruitment is all about red carpet not red tape so simply click on ‘Apply Now' before midnight 19th November.  Please note that a Codility test will be planned for pre selected candidates and a work task during interview.  Other relevant information:  Appointment will be subject to abiding by our Flexible Working Procedure which defines the number of required in-office days at Level 5, 555 Bourke Street (including the ‘team day' of your team) and completion of both the VPS Pre-Employment Statutory Declaration, Misconduct Declaration and Consent Form and the Pre-Employment Health Declaration.  Your appointment may be subject to a satisfactory National Police Record Check, provision of evidence of qualifications required for your position and/or a probation period.  VLSB+C is committed to equal employment opportunity, ethical practice, diversity, inclusion and providing reasonable adjustments for persons with disabilities.  If you have any questions or need assistance to fully participate in the process, please contact People and Culture on 03 9679 8073 or peopleandculture@lsbc.vic.gov.auShow moreReport

Employment Type Permanent Closing Date 27 Nov 2023 11:59pm Job Title Finance Analyst Job Summary Job Description We are Australia's leading telecommunications and technology company. And with a global presence in more than 22 countries, we have a strong global footprint. Our purpose is to build a connected future so everyone can thrive. We are all about providing the best experience and delivering the best tech on the best network. This includes making Telstra the place you want to work. We fully support flexibility and choice at Telstra and what we offer is as unique as you. Will you choose to work from home, in a Telstra workspace, or on the go? A regional location or the CBD? We want you to work where, when, and how you are most engaged, safe, and productive. About the Role As a Finance Analyst you play a pivotal role by supporting your team with timely, accurate and insightful analysis to enable effective decision making by key stakeholders and business partners. You support the coordination and development of operating plans that underpin strategic business unit goals and apply your sound analytical skills to share insights and recommendations into financial status and performance. You have lots of initiative with a strong desire to help tackle strategic issues relating to its operational performance and estimated financial trajectory. You enjoy working independently as well as part of a team to stimulate behaviours that drive value and achieve strategic objectives. As a Finance Analyst you will develop, maintain and continuously improve assigned operational accounting activities. Work with members of the team and key stakeholders to support the achievement of business performance against commitments. Under limited supervision and in line with company policy and processes, you will provide on time accurate data, analysis, supporting assigned financial accounting including tax accounting. Key Responsibilities This is how you'll bring the purpose of your role to life, as a Finance Analyst you will: Support team members and senior management with financial analysis and modelling to develop short- and long-term strategies, as well as key performance indicators to achieve business initiatives and objectives. Leverage your technical expertise and critical thinking skills to generate meaningful insights and recommendations. Participate in sessions with interdepartmental stakeholders, contributing quality financial analysis and timely advice to various business groups aligned to strategic financial objectives. Take accountability for assigned work tasks, working independently when contributing to core activities such as key financial accounting activities associated with month end and year end closes, reconciliations, assurance and tax accounting across numerous legal entities and business areas. Continue to build your subject matter expertise through active thought leadership, to understand key drivers and trends impacting financial and operational performance. Leverage your analytical skills to undertake high-quality quantitative and qualitative analysis, to assist team members to test ideas/business hypotheses, understand issues and provide insights into key decisions. Apply a continuous improvement mindset when approaching tasks using best practice approaches. About you To be successful in the role of Finance Analyst, you will have: Tertiary qualifications in accounting and/or finance. Understand management and financial systems. Experience in financial accounting activities e.g. financial close, general ledger reconciliations and variance analysis. .Tax Accounting experience e.g. return preparation, tax effect accounting would be considered favourably. Demonstrated clear communication skills both written and oral to finance and non-finance audiences. Ability to work independently and take accountability. Analytical mindset with an ability to think broadly and to appropriately question and challenge current assumptions and to make improvements to finance processes and solutions. Experience in large Corporate Environments is required. If this opportunity sounds like a perfect fit for you, we'd encourage you to apply! We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce in all its forms. We encourage applicants from diverse gender, cultural and linguistic backgrounds and applicants who may be living with a disability. We also offer flexibility in all our roles, to ensure everyone can participate. To learn more about how we support our people, including accessibility adjustments we can provide you through the recruitment processShow moreReport
