Help us become the #1 in Property Data. Experience Hybrid working arrangements in a flexible environment. Permanent role which can be based in either Richmond or Sydney. We're REA REA Group is not your average digital business. From humble beginnings in a garage in Melbourne’s east in 1995, we have grown into a leading global digital business, specialising in property.  With bold and ambitious goals, we are changing the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help with every step - whether that's finding or financing your next home.  Our people are the key to our success. At the heart of everything we do, is a thriving culture centred around high performance and care. We are purpose driven and collaborative, which drives innovation and our ability to make a real impact. As such, we’re proud to be named in Australia’s “Top 5” Best Workplaces two years in a row, as well as being recognised as a Best Workplace for Women. Where the team fits in REA is evolving how it leverages data and technology to deliver benefits for customers. After the acquisition of PropTrack in May-18, and following large growth in recent years, we are now looking for an experienced Business Analyst to help build the systems and applications of B2B API and web application solutions for the banking sector. PropTrack provides property data and technical platform solutions to customers in the financial and government sectors. The Engineering Team within PropTrack works together to deliver solutions to our internal and external customers. It is the core delivery centre for developing solutions to meet customer priorities and align with PropTrack’s technology strategy. You will be working collaboratively with our external clients and internal product and technical team members to help deliver and support PropTrack’s B2B API and web application solutions for the banking sector. Liaising with major-bank and internal stakeholders (Clients, Product Owners, Delivery Leads, Developers and Quality Analysts) documenting and diagramming business requirements and processes to assist with understanding functional requirements; Generation of requirement and solution design documents, business process diagrams, data dictionaries, requirement analysis maps, user stories and use cases, interface specification documents, functional and non-functional specification documents; Ensuring that requirements are understood through story kick offs and constant communication using a variety of analysis and documentation techniques including the application of visualisation techniques to underpin joint understanding of processes and data; Working closely with stakeholders to understand and advise on how the requirements are implemented; Communicating any requirement dependencies, issues or risks identified through the analysis process; Contributing to the team’s understanding and prioritisation during planning meetings and retrospectives; Contributing to Showcases; Participating in estimation sessions by describing the requirements and clarifying any questions raised; Addressing any requirement questions or issues that arise during the delivery process; Using your analytical skills to support production issues; Facilitating and participating in team standups, retrospectives & iteration planning sessions; Communicating constantly with key stakeholders, team mates and other people throughout the company; Contributing to the REA BA Guild; Who we’re looking for 5+ years’ experience as a BA in digital product delivery Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to run workshops and to communicate effectively with Product Owners, Delivery Leads, Developers, External Clients and other stakeholders across the organisation Creative problem solver with a keen technical aptitude, able to quickly grasp concepts and add new insights Technical fluency, able to understand and document technical requirements Ability to author high-quality customer-facing project documents Work productively in a fast paced and agile environment Experience with XML and JSON API solutions Experience with data analysis, SQL, MSSQL Server and/or BigQuery database technologies Experience with both waterfall and agile project methodologies Significant exposure to release/testing/change management workflows Business Analysis Certification (e.g. CBAP, PBA or similar) or equivalent industry experience Prior experience in mortgage or lending will be a plus The REA experience The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously. You will have: A demonstrated understanding of data analysis and validation techniques in SAP environment Attention to detail and accuracy in managing data in the system Ability to create supporting documentation including (Master Data process documents, Data Standard Documents, Data flow diagrams etc.) Ability to work effectively in a dynamic environment and use team work to resolve problems and issues within and outside of our direct accountabilities Strong attention to detail, analytical and problem-solving skills Strong communication skills (written, verbal & interpersonal) Strong stakeholder management skills Intermediate to advanced Excel skills FMCG and dairy industry experience would also be highly regarded. What we can offer you! Great cultural environment in a proud, Australian family-owned business A variety of benefits including a Short-Term Incentive Program, corporate clothing, delicious take-home product allowance, and free on-site parking at all our sites Ability to work remotely in line with the needs of the role This is a unique opportunity to truly make your mark & contribute to the success of the iconic Bulla Dairy Foods brand. Will you actively create a healthier future for tomorrow?  At Medibank we’re encouraged to think big. We have a clear purpose to impact better health outcomes for our customers, patients and our community.  We celebrate diversity of thought because we want to make better decisions for our customers. As we work towards our goal of better health for better lives, we value the knowledge and contribution of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders. We are working hard to create an inclusive workplace and develop Indigenous careers.   The role In this role that sits in the Commercial Performance Squad within Strategy and Analytics, you will have the opportunity to support the Financial Products team to deliver analytical insights and recommendations.  The best part of the role? No two days will look the same and you will always have the opportunity to apply your analytical expertise to some of our most interesting problems. As a Senior Analysis you will partner with the Financial Products squads to enable timely and informed decision making that enhances member and enterprise value.  Where you can add value Use advance analytics techniques, systems and software to resolve key questions in a timely fashion by developing fact-based strategic recommendations. Use appropriate prioritisation criteria and techniques when evaluating issues and initiatives. Enhance data management processes, tools and capabilities by contributing to continuous improvement activity and lifting skills by sharing knowledge and experience. Forming a detailed understanding of available datasets using a range of analytical toolsets and strong data analytics background in SQL and SAS Building reports in line with needs of the business – with a specific focus on supporting the Squads with insight development. Home office set up allowance of $650 Laptop and headset provided 14 weeks paid parental leave 15 personal leave days per year Training and development opportunities Onsite parking, canteen, social events, skill-sharing and networking opportunities Please keep reading. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So, if you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please apply or get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit. Here at YVW we are truly committed to supporting the health and wellbeing of our customers and our staff. This is not just a purpose statement, it does drive action here. One such action is to ensure our employees are paid fairly regardless of gender. We do this by having what we call our “best and final offer approach” to salary. This means that our salary offer will be firm (with no negotiation) because our offer is based solely on the value of the role you are employed to perform. This is our way of ensuring our people are paid the same salary for roles of similar value and that there is no unconscious bias when we set pay. IN A NUTSHELL  Bellroy is a growing global company with 12+ years of success. We have expanded our reach to 172 countries, serving over 1,200 retail locations and releasing about 50 new products a year. Resilience is deeply ingrained in the fabric of our business, as we embrace the challenges of a dynamic global economy marked by constrained supply chains, rising costs, and fluctuating currencies. We are seeking a skilled business analyst, specialising in margin and pricing analysis, to dig into our data and refine and adapt our margin-management processes to drive sustainable growth.  You will play a vital role in transforming the source data into accessible, usable and actionable information that directly bolster the business's decision-making process. Collaborating cross-functionally throughout the organisation, you will enhance our understanding and optimisation of pricing and margins. By examining the drivers influencing our costs and establishing forecasts and performance metrics, you will facilitate the margin-monitoring function across all revenue channels. You will contribute to shaping our pricing strategy and oversee its implementation, ensuring suitable pricing for our extensive product range and global marketplaces in 18 currencies.  We're really after someone who is fascinated by the applied side of business analysis. You're someone who really wants data to be used to make a difference in the world, and you want to be at the heart of making that happen. If you bring your clear-thinking mind, and focus on practical applications of data to help us, our world-class team will give you the freedom, resources and support you need to make a difference.  YOU COULD BE THE ONE IF YOU HAVE…  4-8 years of experience working with large sets of data, including sourcing data from different systems, pulling it together and drawing practical insights out of it. Strong stakeholder management and communication skills with both technical and non-technical individuals. Advanced skills in spreadsheet modelling and data visualisation using BI tools. Proficiency in writing SQL queries and ability to think about data flows: given some messy source data, you can find a clean normalised form. An interest in the commercial aspects of a business like Bellroy (for example, understanding what drives gross profit). A knack for seeing which insights and pieces of information are the important ones for decision making, and an interest in designing reports that focus on the most important pieces while giving enough context to let people dive deeper if they want to. The desire to get your hands a bit dirty, you want to be involved in the implementation of the process you create so you can understand what is working and what you can do better next time. An interest in programming (you don't have to be a data scientist, a programmer or a statistician, but you probably have dabbled a bit in this area).   IF YOU WERE HERE LAST MONTH YOU MIGHT HAVE:  Analysed our supply chain costs to understand how they differ by product type and country; understand how this is impacting our landed cost & in turn our margins in each marketplace then presented your findings to our Finance Manager Identified key margin performance metrics and developed a BI dashboard that helps you visualise and track their performance Kicked off a project to reengineer our existing pricing process and data flows. As a first step, used SQL to explore raw datasets across a multitude of variables related to our pricing methodology. Completed a pricing review after recent foreign exchange rate volatility, rolled out the updates across relevant systems and provided key stakeholders with a report that outlines the changes. Improved the spreadsheet model used to calculate regional prices for a new product range to make it more robust and scalable; then shared and discussed the proposed prices with regional managers Spent time with our wholesale team understanding our discount and markup rates to make recommendations to improve our profitability while maintaining healthy sales growth Discussed logistics costing with our Logistics and Sales Operations Manager and built a dashboard to monitor costs by provider Spoken with our Chief Production Officer to understand what is driving costs within manufacturing to see how we can optimise this space further Advised our CFO on pricing updates in one of our growing marketplaces   LOCATION & HOURS  This is a full-time role based out of our new Collingwood office (with WFH options).Show moreReport

Process Business Analyst Join a collaborative team working on exciting transformation projects where you can make a real impact on our business! Work from the office and home in a rhythm that suits you Permanent role based in Melbourne or Sydney We are certified carbon neutral and committed to reducing our impact on the environment. We have long-term partnerships with charities working to address homelessness. We're REA REA Group is not your average digital business. From humble beginnings in a garage in Melbourne’s east in 1995, we have grown into a leading global digital business, specialising in property.  With bold and ambitious goals, we are changing the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help with every step - whether that's finding or financing your next home.  Our people are the key to our success. As such, we’re proud to be named in Australia’s “Top 5” Best Workplaces two years in a row, as well as being recognised as a Best Workplace for Women. Where the team fits in Financial Services sits at the unique juncture of REA Group's vast consumer audience on realestate.com.au, the nationally recognised Mortgage Choice brand, and the unparalleled property data and insights offered by PropTrack. We are working to bring these elements together to deliver true innovation in how Australians find and finance property. Collect relevant information through the mapping of different business processes and workshop to optimise processes Inspect business processes, identify flaws, and find ways to improve them. Examine the best practices of businesses and technological developments to automate and streamline business processes efficiently. Engage with stakeholders to outline business goals and determine ways to achieve them successfully. Prepare visualisations of “current” state and “to-be” state of processes Prepare presentations and reports to inform the initial and ongoing analysis of process, productivity and success measures. Communicate with stakeholders across business to understand the up and downstream implications of changes, closely monitor business operations and mitigate potential risks. Conduct regular meetings with important stakeholders of operational processes. Understand the specific requirements of businesses and provide evidence-based recommendations for effective improvements. Collect and analyse data and make recommendations to meet the objectives of projects and prepare presentations for clients. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously. Work type: Permanent Full time Region: VIC- Melbourne CBD  Make a genuine difference through the work you do Make a real difference for our customers and communities Bring your ideas, ambitions, and passions both in and outside of work   This is a great opportunity to join a winning team in a period of investment, growth, and transformation; committed to delivering fantastic outcomes for customers and colleagues within NAB's Business Bank.  It’s more than a career at NAB. It’s about more opportunity, more moments to make a difference and more focus on you.   About the role:  The Business Credit Management team within NAB Business Lending Product is a highly valued specialised function serving Business Lending credit, analytics, data science and monitoring requirements across all elements of the credit and customer lifecycle. This high-performance team contributes to transformation and change initiatives, and business and strategy decisions, as well as risk and governance obligations and fundamental processes to run the business day to day.  The Business Credit Monitoring Senior Analyst role is a key position in the Business Lending Product’s team at NAB. In this role, you will have the unique opportunity to drive insights from our Business Lending portfolio and play a critical role in identifying and implementing strategic actions based on your analysis. If you consider the current macro environment, as well as our growth and transformation agenda, this is a very exciting and interesting space to be part of right now!  The role will be instrumental in providing accurate and timely analysis to manage the performance of acquisition and customer management credit risk strategies in Business Lending. Your interrogation and interpretation of data, and eg ability to derive actionable insights to our Product, Risk, Digital and Marketing stakeholders will be critical; to ensuring safe growth of automated credit decisioning, and delivering productivity benefits and improving the lending experience for our Business Lending customers. This role is ideal for curious and self-motivated individuals, who have a strong passion for data and analytics, and want to make a real impact  Do you love data, analytics and providing valuable insights to define strategy, drive value and enhance end-to-end experience? Are you ready to make your mark and take the lead?   Your Capabilities, Experience & Qualifications will include:  Tertiary qualifications with quantitative background Knowledge: Credit Risk Management, Business Lending Products Skills: Risk, Data Analysis, Statistical & Visualisation Tools & Techniques, Business Insights Technical: 3+ years’ experience with coding languages such as Python, R, SAS, SQL. Experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI (highly desirable) Strong analytical skills and attention to detail Demonstrated ability to build collaborative partnerships Effective communicator and loves to tell a story using data   Your key accountabilities will include: Developing, building, and managing the monitoring of acquisition and customer management credit strategies and decisioning models, to provide insights and mitigate risks to the business Lead and conduct deep dive analysis to assist in the optimisation of credit decision quality, adherence to agreed risk profile and identification of optimisation opportunities Produce monthly reporting and data delivery for internal stakeholders to support the ongoing monitoring of trends and emerging risks for credit strategies and decisioning models Engage with key stakeholders across the enterprise and work collaboratively with cross functional teams to achieve business outcomes   Make a difference through your work At NAB, we work together to deliver exceptional outcomes that exceed our customers’ expectations. We are an ASX listed organisation that has been serving Australian communities for more than 160 years. We are investing in positive change and our work changes the future of banking. Our colleagues have an impact far beyond work, and you’ll be part of a team that is helping to solve some of society’s biggest challenges.   A diverse and inclusive workplace works better for everyone. We know that our people make us who we are. That's why we have built a culture of respect – where everyone feels valued and appreciated for being their true authentic selves at NAB. With our focus on inclusion and diversity, and in partnership with our Employee Resource Groups, NAB is a place where First Nations colleagues, colleagues of all genders, sexualities and ages, carers and colleagues with disability, and colleagues from all cultures, races and religions have the opportunity to thrive, connect and grow.   More focus on you We are committed to delivering a positive experience for our colleagues and a workplace you can be proud of. We support our colleagues to balance their careers and personal life through flexible working arrangements such as hybrid working and job sharing and competitive financial and lifestyle benefits. We invest in our colleagues through world class development programs (Distinctive Leadership and Career Qualified in Banking), and empower you to learn, grow and pursue exciting career opportunities. To learn more, visit the Benefits of Working at NAB page on our website.   Join NAB  If you think this role is the right fit for you, we invite you to apply. Procurement Analyst Date: 30 Oct 2023 Location: Cremorne, VIC, AU, 3121 Company: Ventia Ventia is one of the largest essential services providers in Australia and New Zealand. We proudly provide the services that keep infrastructure working for our communities. We have a diverse and proud heritage combined with a track record for delivering the best outcomes for our clients and the communities in which we operate.  We are seeking a Procurement Analyst to join the team on a full time basis based at Cremorne, Melbourne.  Reporting to the Reporting and Analytics Manager, the Procurement Analyst will be responsible for partnering with key stakeholders to determine their business needs and provide procurement reports and insights to inform procurement decisions and assist in the development of innovative procurement and category management strategies, policies and processes.  In addition, some of your core responsibilities will include: Support the collecting, cleaning, and organising procurement data from various sources and perform data validation for migrated data where required. Analyse and interpret a wide range of supplier and organisational information and develop reports, forecasts and advice to inform and support procurement planning and decision-making. Research and analyse supply markets to determine market trends to identify opportunities and inform sourcing strategies. Develop, assess and provide reports for the effective management of supplier performance and to track and report on benefits delivered. Review of spend categories, spend analytics and contract portfolios to identify sourcing opportunities complete with thorough risk assessments. Provide analytical reporting for key deliverables, plans, programmes and KPI’s as required. Contributing to a culture of excellence and continuous quality improvement and actively contributing to a culture of comradery and teamwork  About you: Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills. Demonstrated ability to influence stakeholders and work with them to determine acceptable solutions. Advanced technical and modelling skills. Excellent documentation skills. Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations. Competency in standard business tools including Word, Excel, and Outlook. Experience with PowerBI for creating data analytics and reports Experience with SQL Experience with SAPECC Excellent planning, organisation and time management skills. A history of leading and supporting successful projects. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills including the ability to identify issues and develop solutions to complex business issues. Outstanding organisational skills including the ability to manage and prioritise multiple concurrent tasks, meet tight deadlines and to work in an independent, flexible manner where required. Enthusiasm, energy, inquisitiveness, initiative and innovative thinking. Ability to maintain and respect confidentiality of the highest order and a high level of personal integrity  The benefits: Ventia have also partnered with some reputable organisations to be able to offer discounts on Health Insurance, Banking (new home loans, credit cards, everyday bank accounts), flights & accommodation, car hire, car leasing and much more, we also offer the following: A flexible, supportive and inclusive work environment where you matter. We take our people's careers seriously, helping them to learn and grow. There's nothing more important to us than keeping our people and the public safe. Business Analyst behaviour 101: Helping everyone behind their back without them noticing. AND responsible for delivering a large Cooperative Research Centres Project (CRC-P). Sounds like you? Join us as we are looking for a Business Analyst who draws out the needs that are not known yet with a positive attitude and a passion for payments. Who we are? The Novatti Group is a fintech company that enables businesses to pay and be paid from any device, anywhere. By using our solutions, businesses can send money internationally, accept payment from consumers both in-store and online, provide prepaid Visa cards, automate their billing, and a whole bunch of other amazing things needed to operate in a digital and increasingly cashless world. Our clients include everyone from corner stores to start-ups to global organisations, while our key partners are some of the world's biggest and most innovative companies, including Visa, Apple Pay, Google Pay. We are listed on the Australia Stock Exchange (ASX) and have operations in multiple countries globally, including Europe, Malaysia and the US. Most importantly, we are a fast-growing company that is looking for amazing, talented people who want to join us on our journey and grow with us. What will you be doing? As the Business Analyst, one of the main objectives will be to work with the project team responsible for delivering a large Cooperative Research Centres Project (CRC-P) with multiple delivery partners over 3 years. You'll be primarily responsible for partnering with the project team on ad hoc and recurring analyses and building out workflow and systems as our company continues to grow. Reporting to the Head of Engineering, you'll have the opportunity to roll up your sleeves to help scale an organisation that is doing meaningful work in the industry, valuing truth and helping our clients discover it. The role will require you to solve the most complex, interesting challenges of a rapidly scaling team. Importantly, in this role, you will: Capture requirements in collaboration with Product Managers, Solution Architects and Technical Leads. Assist product managers in preparing requirements documents for vendors. Support Solution Architects to produce high-level solution designs based on requirements. Support Technical Leads to produce detailed technical designs based on requirements. Provide clarifications of requirements to the Engineering team. Ensure that defect tickets raised by support teams capture the required details. Work as a part of an Agile delivery team. Draft customer documentation and ensure that it is up to date in collaboration with the Engineering team and Product Managers. Draft business process documentation required by the sales, legal and marketing teams. What would make you a good candidate? Change is constant here so we're always looking for self-starters who can get roll up their sleeves and crack on! To ensure your success in the role we do have a few key requirements so read on and see if any of these align with your skills and experience:  You have a Degree in Computer Science, IT or relevant fields and a solid experience in payments. You have experience in creating business analysis, customer documentation and leading projects using different methodologies like Agile, Lean and/or Six Sigma, etc. You can easily translate data interpretation and analysis into insightful presentations and recommendations. You have a solid understanding of API Technologies, Integration Frameworks and PCI domains. You are a problem solver - you aren't afraid to roll up your sleeves, identify problems, and devise thoughtful solutions. You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills. This is a cross-functional role, and therefore, you should be a cultural champion in the organisation. You have the ability to influence those around you, regardless of role and title - you will always have stakeholders that will directly impact the quality and deadlines of your projects. You are motivated by a fast-paced environment where you will have to constantly adapt with a can-do attitude - no two days are the same, seriously! What it means to work for us Does shaping your own future excite you? Are you inspired by blending your passions and career? At Novatti, we are inspired by the curious-minded, diverse thinkers, and authentic individuals, and we recognize that no two journeys are the same. Some of the other perks of working with us: Opportunities to learn and accelerate career development. A collaborative, team environment with people who truly love what they do. Regular social activities, daily discounts and celebrations. Flexible work arrangements, including remote working. Bill Gates once penned “We are changing the world with technology.” If you feel the same, take the leap and apply with us. To start your application with us, please submit your CV and a cover letter (yep, we do read them) and we will be in touch as soon as we can. Please include the word "#fintechsfuture" at the top of your cover letter so that we know you took the time to read our job ad.Show moreReport

Join us and let’s make a bigger difference together.  It’s an exciting time to be joining Australian Unity – we have grown significantly over recent years and are transforming to capitalise on further growth opportunities to help our customers and employees thrive. We operate with commercial principles and with a strong social purpose to create community value. Australian Unity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Your New Role:  12 Month Fixed Term Contract - The Operational Risk Analyst will support the Group Governance team in the refinement of our Enterprise Risk Management Framework, with a focus on the uplift in operational risk management as required by CPS230.  The role requires a sound understanding of and experience in developing risk and governance frameworks and their policies and procedures. The scope of work includes activities surrounding operational risk management uplift; process review and documentation, risk and controls identification, determination of thresholds, determination of business disruption resilience and recovery processes and metrics and material service provider management policy and processes. About You:  Minimum 5 years’ experience in compliance projects or in risk consulting. Strong documentation writing skills Strong process mapping skills (Viso preferred) A strong working knowledge of common BCM Frameworks such as ISO 22301 or similar A strong understanding of CPS220, CPS230 and ISO 31000 Demonstrated ability to influence others, drive cultural change and gain support for relevant initiatives Exceptional stakeholder management, communication, and problem-solving skills Exposure to third party risk and service management with an understanding of contractual arrangements relating to fourth parties advantageous Experience within a financial services environment advantageous  What Makes Us, Us  Putting people first is not just something we say, it's what we do. We care for our people so they can care for themselves and our customers. We stay true to our values (Bold, Warm, Honest), we work hard because it matters and we work well together – collaborating, encouraging and even managing to have some fun.  At Australian Unity we do the right thing, and we expect the same from others. Being a member-owned company, means we're focused on our members and customers, not shareholder returns. Our purpose to Help People to Thrive, drives us to make a real difference, every day, big and small. We are passionate about improving the wellbeing of all Australians and about making a positive difference. run-books, scope templates Capture and measure customer feedback and work with the Product Manager in converting them into insights and actionable outcomes Requirements Ideally, you’ll have: at least 5 years’ of experience working with technical products and SaaS integrations, ideally using APIs a customer mindset to help achieve the best implementation outcomes an ability to work on multiple projects proactively and simultaneously in a fast-paced environment impeccable communication skills, both written and oral, and ability to work with internal and external stakeholders a strong ability to interpret and effectively present technical information the ability to work independently whilst at the same time engaging cross-functional teams payments or finance-related experience in a B2B environment is highly advantageous Technical skills that will make you successful in this role: Confident with SQL and data analysis Knowledge of REST APIs - About Vanguard Vanguard Australia has been helping investors achieve their long-term financial goals for over 20 years. Serving institutional and individual clients, and financial advisers, we offer investment solutions that are low-cost, diversified and robust through time. With more than AUD $11 trillion in assets under management Vanguard is one of the world’s largest global investment management companies. In Australia we partner with institutional clients, financial advisers and individual investors to offer low-cost investment solutions. Our comprehensive range of managed funds, exchange traded funds (ETFs) and tailored investment solutions are built to support long-term investment success for our clients.  Our Team & Opportunity At Vanguard Investments Australia (VIA), we have a focus on increasing our efforts to serve Australian investors directly and as part of that journey, we are working on an expansion of our offering to include superannuation. Australia has one of the best retirement systems in the world and we want to help make it better for all Australians. With significant global and local expertise in the retirement space, coupled with our disciplined, low-cost approach to investing we are committed to helping more Australians reach their retirement goals. As part of this goal, we are now looking to recruit a Superannuation Product Management Analyst to join our Superannuation Proposition and Experience team. The Product Management Analyst will be instrumental in Supporting the offer leads and journey team to help define and execute the strategy for Vanguard Super’s accumulation, retirement and insurance offers. We are on an exciting journey to build and develop the strongest product offering that delivers value to our customers and Product Management Analyst plays an integral role delivering analysis and insights as well as playing a key role defining and implementing our offering. What you will do Work closely with the Offer Leads & Journey Owner on the definition and implementation of the overall superannuation offer across accumulation, retirement & insurance Play a key role in delivering competitive and member analysis for Vanguard Super offers, preparing and presenting strategic insights and recommendations to key stakeholders Support the Offer Leads with analysis, reporting and development of research papers in accordance with the Product Governance Framework and associated policies. Support the creation of dynamic content used to position Vanguard's superannuation products including product disclosures and member facing content. Contributing to Superannuation thought leadership and building knowledge of Vanguard’s global capability. Develop relationships and engage with vendors such as researchers and consultants. Development of presentation material for internal use Working as part of project teams to support the delivery of offer and product solutions. What we are looking for Experience working in product or offer development teams in the investment management, superannuation or other financial services organisations Product disclosure experience in developing, issuing and meeting obligations. Demonstrated experience in requirements gathering, data analysis and delivering insights that influence decision making Demonstrated experience effectively communicating and delivering with internal and external stakeholders, within a dynamic and fast-paced environment Specialisations that will make an impact Undergraduate degree in a related field is desirable and any relevant post graduate qualifications would be highly regarded Knowledge of regulatory framework and environment including the SIS Act, Stronger Super, APRA prudential standards Experience working within a superannuation fund and with external outsourced partners Experience with agile practices Inclusion Statement Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.” We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values. When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard’s core purpose. Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success. Where to from here? job_title: People & Capability Reporting Analyst - 12 month FTC
job_description: Brighter Futures Start Here As Australia’s biggest and most loved retailer, we’ve been brightening up everyday life for families for over 50 years. At our stores, distribution centres, and offices in Australia and New Zealand. All around the globe. Our diverse and inclusive 47,000 strong team come together for a common cause. Giving families easy access to our on-trend products and incredibly low prices – it’s the heart of everything we do. As a leader in the retail market, we’re optimistic about our future and yours. We’re relentless in our pursuit for results, but changing at a rapid rate, giving you challenging work that you’ll be proud of. We celebrate your uniqueness and individuality. Because at Kmart it’s not just what you do, it’s who you are that makes every day living brighter.  Join the team  Join our dynamic People and Capability (P&C) reporting team, where you'll play a pivotal role in delivering HR reporting excellence. As a Reporting Analyst, you will extend your passion for numbers and data to provide invaluable insights and reporting for our P&C team and the broader store network. If you have a passion for reporting, can tell stories with data and you're a PowerBI enthusiast who thrives on collaborating with stakeholders, this 12-month fixed-term opportunity would be an ideal platform to step up and make a significant impact! What you’ll be doing  As a Reporting Analyst you will: Spearhead the delivery of people reporting across the business, ensuring its accuracy and relevance for strategic decision-making. Develop dashboards and uphold business intelligence (BI) administration ensuring data integrity and consistency. Provide vital support to P&C by delivering periodic and ad-hoc reporting requirements. Continuously refine and enhance key HR metrics, cubes, dimensions, and reporting facts. Proactively identify data trends and anomalies and provide insights and recommendations for improvement and optimisation in reporting. Participate in projects that require data analysis and reporting support.  To be successful in this role you’ll have: Proficiency and demonstrated experience in business intelligence systems, with a particular emphasis on PowerBI. A working knowledge of SAP SuccessFactors in both Employee Central and Employee Central Payroll, while being open to learning and adapting to new systems. Exceptional proficiency in MS Excel, including advanced features such as pivot tables, macros, advanced formulas, and charting functions. Strong communication skills with the ability to confidently communicate and present data with meaningful insights and findings to all levels of management, including our Executive Leadership Team. The capability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-volume environment, effectively multitask, and prioritize tasks. Strong problem-solving skills, including the ability to use data and insights to drive recommendations.  Benefits we’ll offer you:  Flexible hybrid working options through our Flex Where, Flex When, Flex Well policy, spending 60% of your week in our National Offices. A team member discount card that gives you a discount at Kmart, Target, Bunnings, and Officeworks A free OnePass membership offering free delivery across Kmart, Target & Catch on eligible products Access to the Kmart for You benefits program which entitles you to exclusive discounts and benefits in the areas of entertainment, travel, lifestyle, and health – with over 60 suppliers! Free onsite parking when you’re required to come into the office We offer inclusive parental leave, a family room and ongoing support offered though our partnership with Circle In for team members of all backgrounds and family circumstances A dynamic learning and support program Opportunity to fast track your career through our Mentor Program as a Mentee or Mentor In-house café that serves breakfast, lunch and includes a collaborative space to work in A reflection room that can be used for prayer, meditation, or time for you A Kudos recognition program, where you are nominated by your peers to spin a wheel, to win a stack of cool prizes Regular product sample sales with loads of discounted items to purchase Great career opportunities across the broader Wesfarmers Group  We’re here to make everyday living brighter  From humble beginnings in Burwood East, Victoria, in 1969, we’re now an essential part of 300 communities, and proud of it! From bedding to apparel to kitchenware and beyond. We’re designing and creating the products people reach for every day. In-store, online, or Click & Collect – getting the products we love into the hands of happy customers is what we aim to do best. From the remote outback to coastal towns and big cities, and everywhere in-between. We’re progressive in our pursuit to create seamless customer journeys for satisfied shoppers. A place you can belong  At Kmart, we celebrate the rich diversity of the communities in which we operate and are committed to creating inclusive and safe environments where all our team members can contribute and succeed. We believe that all team members should feel valued, respected and safe irrespective of your gender, ethnicity, indigeneity, religious beliefs, education, age, disability, family responsibilities, sexual orientation and gender identity and we encourage applications from all candidates. We believe that everyone should have the opportunity to be their best, when applying for a role or working at Kmart. We encourage you to tell us about any workplace adjustments that you would like, by emailing diversity@kmart.com.au If you would like to explore a career with Kmart and this sounds like the perfect role for you – apply now! We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.  #LI-HybridShow moreReport

Why AE Capital? ﻿ AE Capital is focused on forecasting the future. Our approach is scientific and combines the power of human expertise with machine learning to create algorithms that predict the world’s financial markets. As with complex problems like weather forecasting, the best forecasts come from humans interacting with the computer models and we have been developing a similar philosophy in finance for over 10 years.  AE Capital is one of the few businesses in the world to have successfully used machine learning in finance, and our commitment to continuous improvement in all that we do has led to another recent breakthrough. We have developed a framework that allows traditional “discretionary” traders to create algorithmic trading models, without the need for programming experience. Secondly, we have created specialised data sets that allow machine learning experts to apply their trade without the need for deep financial expertise.  We now need talented individuals who can bring their expertise and domain knowledge - whether it be in financial markets, data science, computer science, software engineering or infrastructure - and apply their skills to our new methodology as we grow.  We are always on the lookout for self-motivated, results-driven analytical minds who enjoy problem solving and can bring their skills and experience to our team. This is a unique opportunity to learn from industry leaders in our collaborative and hands-on environment, pushing the boundaries of finance and technology.  Enjoy the many benefits of working for AE Capital, at our offices in Melbourne, one of the world’s most liveable cities. With flexible work hours, genuine autonomy, and the ability to have a direct impact on the business, our unique culture embodies the Aussie spirit of mateship, teamwork, and the open exchange of ideas in a fun, dynamic and informal environment. What we look for Nearly everything we do at AE Capital is unique and different which results in our world leading outcomes. The continued success of this requires teamwork, strong problem-solving skills, great communication and lots of (dead-end) experimentation.  So, when ploughing through these tough problems, we want to work with likeminded people who are passionate and excited about what they do are loyal and honest to each other are hard working have a thirst for knowledge and try to solve one’s own problems focus on the detail and correctness of their work and are dedicated to get the job done because this, above all else, will determine our continued, mutual success. Quantitative Analyst  The job  As a Quantitative Analyst you will use your expertise in computer modelling to work with our traders and contribute to the design and development of our predictive models, that our quantitative developers and software engineers then bring to life.  We are a “Bayesian” firm that values intuitive priors and empirical inference to identify and prove a theory or relationship. We are not afraid to explore new ideas and being "applied academics” at the core, we will encourage theoretical and practical pursuits in data science, machine learning, stochastic processes, optimization, signal processing and control systems, to name a few. Financial markets are truly the most humbling of all predictive systems and the optimal place to test and hone your skills.  We are a small and agile company that will provide you with the ability to engage and work across all areas of the business and collaborate with all your colleagues to collectively design and build solutions that result in measurable, positive outcomes.  About You:  You will need to be articulate, intelligent, naturally inquisitive, and thrive in environments that encourage new ideas and value thought leadership.  You will need to be able to demonstrate:  A strong academic foundation with a passion for truth and the scientific method A high-level of initiative and self-motivation. Excellent coding skills and deep experience with big data sets (Matlab, Python, C, Fortran, or similar).  Ideally you will be comfortable in a Unix environment with knowledge of cluster computing. A willingness to further develop and specialize your skills including the knowledge of financial markets if you are new to the industry. Your background  Masters or PhD in Physics, Atmospheric Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or an equivalent discipline Exposure to financial markets and software development will be advantageous but not essential for the right person. We are happy to consider entry level and experienced applicants. If you are accountable, professional, enjoy a collaborative high achieving team environment and want to work with some of the brightest and best in the business, all you need to do is send us your CV and Cover letter. We’ll invite you to undertake a few quick online assessments and then be in touch.  In return we will provide you with a work environment and opportunity that will enable you to thrive, be heard and be valued; plus be very well compensated.  The AE Capital talent team do not require recruitment agency support, we have this covered. Click here to applyShow moreReport

East Melbourne, VIC, AU, 3002 Permanent The name IXOM may be new to you (it’s only a few years old) but as an organisation we’ve been around for over a century. We now have more than 1,100 employees across 10 countries, so far.  IXOM is a market leader in chemical manufacturing and distribution in Australia and New Zealand, with an increasing presence throughout South East Asia and North America.  Every day, we provide solutions to a range of industries including dairy, water, and food & beverage.  Chances are, we are already part of your everyday life, in some way or another. This is an exciting time to join our business as we move towards a sustainable, successful, and promising future.  Your role  It is an exciting time to join our business as we continue along our journey of ongoing expansion, change and transformation. Through continued growth and success, we are searching for an experienced Commercial Finance Analyst who is looking to work alongside a strong leader as a mentor, within a supportive and collaborative work environment.  Within a high-performance culture, this action-oriented role provides financial and analytical support to a broad range of stakeholders while gaining a better understanding of business needs. Your open, engaging communication style will allow you to share knowledge and valuable insights in this genuine business partnering role. In this role, you will be closely partnering with product and account managers across our Traded Products team to deliver their annual growth targets and strategic objectives, with a focus on pricing and business case support. Your responsibilities  Partner with the commercial business leaders to improve financial outcomes, support decision making and identify & implement strategic growth initiatives Ensure commercial arrangements progress through a robust financial model and decision-making framework to ensure they add value, meet agreed KPIs and mitigate risk Support the pricing strategy by delivering efficient pricing to improve the quality of earnings on all products across the portfolio Support on investment decisions by constructing business cases with integrated financial models to support growth activities and to assess business risks/opportunities Support the Finance Business Partner across a variety of tasks including the preparation of month end commentary and monthly management reporting pack, providing fact-based insight of business performance and preparation of presentations for Senior Executives Forward looking assessment and challenge of projected business performance, validation of S&OP input assumptions Drive disciplines and approach for ongoing portfolio reviews (fix and exit decisions) Support the business to conduct analysis of market growth/share, ensuring a detailed understanding of the competitor landscape, identifying potential risks and opportunities for the business Preparation and maintenance of 3-way corporate and strategy planning model, actively track performance against strategic KPI’s  Your skills & experience  Tertiary qualification in Commerce, Finance or Accounting is essential A professional qualification (CA or CPA) would be valued Experience in commercial finance, pricing or analytical role in a manufacturing organisation Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills and working knowledge using data analytics tools (Power BI preferred) High degree of commercial acumen with superior attention to detail Strong analytical skills and experience in an analysis role; comfortable working with large data sets Experience in a fast-paced environment and flexibility to juggle multiple tasks and priorities Strong interpersonal and influencing skills and ability to work with people at all levels, with confidence to challenge in the right way to influence better outcomes Highly regarded is having ERP knowledge (preferably SAP) along with HFM experience  Your benefits at IXOM  For a start, you’ll work for a large successful global organisation, where you’ll not only earn a competitive salary, you’ll have access to an Employee Assistance Program, a Recognition Program, and a range of health and benefits discounts. You’ll be provided with ongoing learning and development to meet your professional needs. You’ll be supported by an accessible leadership team who are driven by a solid values platform that underpins who we are and how we operate. What’s more, you’ll find yourself working with a flexible, diverse, and inclusive workforce. We celebrate and nurture our people. We’re focused on embracing change. There is no better time to join us. Your next step  Please note that you must have full working rights to apply.  No agencies please. Ixom will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. You. After all, that’s who we’re really interested in. We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.  About Our Process At Ixom we are committed to employing individuals who align with our values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, and reference checks.Show moreReport

At Journal Technologies, we believe our technology can be a force for good in the world ensuring the proper and efficient functioning of some of the most foundational aspects of society - the courts and justice system. We create and implement enterprise software that supports the administration of justice, currently in the United States, Canada, and Australia. While our eSeries product suite enables governments and their employees to deliver continued foundational court processes, our R&D focuses on leveraging emerging possibilities with technology to improve access and efficiency. Headquartered in Los Angeles, Journal Technologies is a long-time, wholly-owned subsidiary of Daily Journal Corporation (NASDAQ: DJCO). We also have a major office in Logan, Utah, a team in Melbourne, Australia, and a growing number of remote staff across North America and the world. Under our next generation of leadership, we're implementing a new vision for the company that prioritizes building an extraordinary workplace with empowered people at the heart of our business. Great people want to collaborate with great people, and we are actively looking for smart, motivated people who care deeply about the work they do. Senior Technical Business Analyst  Journal Technologies is looking for a Senior Technical Business Analyst who will focus on system implementation, data analysis and engagement. A successful candidate will be responsible for identifying, analyzing and documenting all data and business requirements. This role does not require any coding skills but a need to understand the system and basic SQL would be highly beneficial. Responsibilities:  Lead requirement gathering sessions and workshops with clients; analyze and explain solution options and recommend the most feasible solution(s) Help users resolve application issues Identify and document user and system issues Create database queries using T-SQL Assist in the maintenance of applications Create and maintain job schedules, job tracking, client communications, team communications, reports, and other documents that may be required Coordinate project activities with business stakeholders Produce organized and informative system documentation, including details of application configuration and installation and infrastructure Support Testing processes (both IT & business testing) Identify solutions, manage project scope, risks and issues and the end-to-end delivery schedule Partner with Business and Technology stakeholders to ensure business and technical stakeholders are aligned Gather requirements, conduct gap analyses, and define business processes. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive transformation and process improvement   Requirements:  7+ years of relevant professional experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis B.A./B.S. or equivalent work experience Self-starter accustomed to a fast-paced environment Broad knowledge in application software, technologies, and networking systems Must have excellent oral and written skills for use in writing detailed business requirements and presenting solutions to other team members and clients Willingness to travel up to 50% Ability to communicate customer requirements effectively with product management and development teams   Preferred Qualifications:  Experience with data conversions and data interface projects Experience with Justice agencies, particularly courts Experience in testing packaged software deployed into large enterprises or government departments. Experience with software implementations either with a systems integrator or consulting organization Experience with courts solutions, prosecutor solutions and policing solutions   The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this job function. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties; additional responsibilities may be assigned. Reports to: Andrew Millhouse (Software Implementation Specialist)  Location: Melbourne (Preferred) Why Journal Technologies?  Visit www.journaltech.com/careers for more information, but highlights include: Competitive compensation based on skills, experience, and years of service. Identifiant de la demande: 12257 Lieu de travail: Southbank, AU, 3006 About US (GEMS): ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.  ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group’s large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.  3,300 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.  Our +120,00 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.  Our 4 expertises: Asset managementEnergy transition servicesEnergy supply & global commoditiesRisk management & market access  At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.  More info on GEM Hub (https://gems.engie.com) or LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions).  About ENGIE: Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 170,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.  Context: Within the GEMS Business Unit, the Australia and New Zealand Business Platform (BP ANZ) are managing and developing the group’s trading activities for these regions around 4 main pillars: risk management and market access, asset management, green solutions and energy supply businesses.  The missions of the BP ANZ are: Support the development and the operations of the other GBUs (Global Business Units) in all aspects related to risk representation and risk managementDevelop a commercial franchise which contributes to the overall risk management of the portfolio and generates value  The GEMS ANZ Analytics team develops market insights and quantitative models. These are used to optimise dispatchable assets, forecast customer consumptions, risk manage positions, assess long term prices, value hedging product and shape strategy.  The purpose of this role is to provide subject matter expertise for quantitative commodity trading models built by the Analytics team. The analysis and insights generated will lead to improved decision making across the rest of GEMS ANZ and the wider ANZ business.  Role: The incumbent is responsible and accountable for the following key responsibilities: activities which can align to evolve with the business’ requirements.  Develop quantitative financial models to value energy derivatives (Power, Green, Gas)Engage with the Forward Trading and Commercial teams to develop and operate models and tools to support trading decisionsWork together with Head of Analytics or Head of Forward Power Trading on complex, ill-defined tasks with minimal assistance from Manager (i.e. gather requirements, come up with design, implement and test)Ensure that the analytical work is complete to a high standard and on time, while regularly communicating the status of the projectProvide thought leadership and creativity in developing innovative solutions to new problems, together with the Head of Analytics and Principal Analyst Quantitative ModellingProactively suggest new possibilities for analytics/projects to the Head of Analytics and Head of Forward Power Trading  The incumbent must adhere to all regulatory and compliance requirements relevant to the requirements of the role. You must comply with all Health Safety & Environment compliance requirements, as they apply to your position, other team members and to the Company.  Education and professional background: Tertiary degree in relevant disciplineMasters/PhD in Quantitative Discipline (Maths/Physics/Engineering) favourableExperienced within the wholesale electricity, gas, and financial markets (ideally in Australia) and the fundamentals of how these markets operate and interact.  Hard skills: 1 to 5 years relevant experience to the roleNEM experience favourableExperience developing and running quantitative models to support commodity trading. E.g. Option valuation modelsTechnical / programming skillsSQL, Microsoft Excel, coding in R and Python Statistical skills  Soft skills: Organisation, analysis, and interpretation of numerical dataExcellent analytical thinker and problem solverWork revolves around coming up with models, tools and techniques that have not been done before, as such, there is a lot of experimentationProject Leadership and mentoring of junior team members  If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time! Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender. job_title: Senior Pricing Insights and Data Analyst
job_description: A career with Viva Energy is more than just a job. It’s an opportunity to be part of something bigger. To support the world's evolving energy needs by producing and supplying energy products that keep Australian's moving today as we help to build a sustainable future for tomorrow. Will you be part of the energy solution? About the role: A senior role in our Retail Pricing Team you will be responsible for providing actionable insights and reporting. The role aims to improve the way we use data, analytics and insights to make better, more informed strategic business decisions and deliver capabilities of analytics, reporting and insights. This position will suit someone who is customer-obsessed, thrives in a fast-paced and dynamic environment where no day is ever the same, and is passionate about driving commercial outcomes and incremental value to the business through a strong data-driven and analytical approach. The ideal candidate will demonstrate a sense of urgency whilst maintaining high levels of accuracy; is highly skilled at using data and appropriate metrics to validate ROI and KPI measures; is able to exhibit a willingness to learn, grow, and contribute to the overall success of the team; can demonstrate high levels of technical competency, and has a high level of commercial acumen. The Senior Data and Insights analyst will be a champion of data, reporting and insights for the Mobility Fuels Pricing Team and will be responsible for leading collaboration across the Fuel Pricing Analysts and broader Convenience and Mobility analyst groups to seek out and proactively develop new and disruptive fuel pricing strategies to build profitable market share The Senior Pricing Insights and Data Analyst will have the following accountabilities; Providing deep insights and analysis to the Retail Pricing Team and wider business Extract business requirements and to ensure reports / dashboards are relevant, user-friendly and effective for business needs Analyse data, interpret trends/patterns and synthesise them into business insights to inform decision-making Develop, create dashboard reporting in Power BI Provide insights and analysis on network, site level and product, competitors, margin and volume Construct comprehensive forecast models Be a trusted and valued partner in the planning, execution and review process to ensure the desired outcomes for the business are delivered Routine and ad-hoc reporting and analysis Work cross functional to ensure the appropriate capture, storage, accessibility, and availability of relevant data in order to report and deliver insights Build trust in the data, reporting, and dashboards by contributing to quality improvements, data integrity, and the provision of clean and accurate data Support implementation of new systems, process improvement to drive better informed strategic decisions, enabling the sharing of data and developing actionable insights with the wider Consumer business Please keep reading…. You get it done for our customers and our communities. You’re laying the foundations for NAB’s future success. Together we’ll grow, excel for our customers, and make this a workplace to be proud of.  It’s a good time to see what more you can find at NAB as a Senior Analyst Engineer  Responsible for:  The role of Senior Analyst Engineering will provide critical thinking and a high degree of technical innovation and attention to detail while being recognised as a trusted advisor to the team and stakeholders. The Victorian Government Cyber Incident Response Service (CIRS) is seeking a talented and self-motivated Senior Data Analyst to join our team.  CIRS sits within the Department of Government Services. It provides organisations with access to expert cyber incident response and coordination services. This includes technical, forensics and communications specialists. These experts assist with reducing the scope, impact and severity of cyber incidents as they impact the Victorian Government.  The Senior Data Analyst operates within the Cyber Defence Centre (CDC) and is a key member of the CIRSteam. The position is responsible for the leadership, innovation, design, development and delivery of cyber threat and cyber risk insights and analytic products that are produced for Victorian Government stakeholders.  About you  As our ideal candidate, you will have: Demonstrated experience in analytics and business intelligence web and product development and operational support through code (software engineering) and BI products/tooling.  Well-developed communication skills including workshop participation, product demonstration, requirements and design documentation, presentation skills.  Demonstrated experience in analysing issues from different perspective, identifying and proposing workable solutions, implementing solutions and evaluating effectiveness and adjusting actions as required.  Demonstrated experience establishing and maintaining relationships with people at all levels and from different backgrounds and organisations to achieve outcomes and manage risks.  Mandatory requirement   Ability to successfully acquire and maintain a NEGATIVE VETTING 2 level security clearance in Australia (requires Australian citizenship).  The closing date for this position is 19 November 2023. Current VPS employees are strongly encouraged to apply via the Jobs and Skills Exchange (JSE) platform. How to apply Apply before the advertised closing date. All applications should include:   a resume; and a cover letter which addresses the key selection criteria (within three pages).  This position is only open to applicants with relevant rights to work in Australia. Other relevant information The department is committed to providing and maintaining a working environment which is safe and without risk to the health of its employees and clients and consistent with the department's obligations under the Occupational Health and Safety Act 2004 (OH&S Act), to support this DPC has a COVID-19 Vaccination policy which strongly recommends all DPC employees be fully vaccinated. Preferred candidates will be required to complete a Pre-employment Declaration and Consent form. Employment of successful candidates will be subject to a National Police Check. DPC actively promotes diversity, inclusion and an equal opportunity workplace. We welcome applicants from all diverse backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and people with disabilities. All roles at DPC can be worked flexibly, however it may differ from role to role.Show moreReport

We’ve been trusted to serve Aussie communities since 1914 and grown to become a top 30-listed on the ASX with 120,000 team members and a portfolio of iconic brands. At Coles Group, you’ll not only get to make a difference to millions of Aussie lives—you’ll also get to see your impact.  About the team Coles Liquor is a trusted retailer with three iconic trading banners, Liquorland, First Choice Liquor Market and Vintage Cellars. As a drink’s specialist, Coles Liquor hosts an extensive range of wines, spirits and beers and we are passionate about providing customers with local and relevant products. Our knowledgeable Team Members serve customers through our network of more than 950 stores and ultra-convenient online sites, delivering on our commitment to provide accessible drink solutions for every occasion. About the role We have an exciting opportunity for a detail oriented professional with a strong understanding of workforce planning to join the Liquor Central Operations team. This includes the analysis, modelling, measurement and reporting on predetermined hours and REM with accuracy, flexibility, and consistency. You’ll also: Identify and present commercial opportunities to improve store performance Act as a workforce planning SME for designated departments, creating processes and embedding an understanding of Kronos Dimensions with stakeholders Provide insight into how we can structure and approach labour models to best support our availability and commerciality Engage with stakeholders to build pre and post impact analysis, understanding our customer needs as well as ensuring we are aligned to commercial requirements Play a key role in forecasting labour, utilising a consistent and logical approach to distributing hours to support the network About you and your skills You are looking a detail oriented professional with strong understanding of workforce planning systems. You have strong analytical capabilities and the ability to identify root causes of issues.  You’ll also have: Demonstrated experience with business process analysis, development of work standards, documentation of work processes and/or operations logic Strong research and data analysis skills, Proven experience in retail/store operations, combined with strong knowledge of Kronos Dimensions Experience in labour modelling ideal, but not a pre-requisite Take your next step into something bigger, apply now With us it’s not about the discounts (although you do get those), it’s about joining a team where your wellbeing and professional development is invested in and celebrating your contributions is the norm. And because everyone leads unique lives, we offer flexible work including work from home, additional leave and parental leave entitlements. We’re continuing to build a gender equitable team, and a culture that’s just as diverse, inclusive and welcoming as the communities we serve. We encourage applications from people of all ages, cultures (including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples), abilities, sexual orientation and gender identities. We’re happy to adjust our recruitment process to support candidates with disability. Find out more in the ‘Our Recruitment Process’ section of our careers site. Job Description BlueScope is an Australian-born, global success story, spanning 18 countries, with a team of over 15,000 people. We’re driven by innovation and are proud that the technologies in our products and brands, like COLORBOND® steel, inspire and protect everything from hospitals and bridges to stadiums and homes. The Opportunity Come and discover the opportunity to join our People team as a HR Analyst based in either Port Kembla NSW, Mount Waverley VIC or Adelaide SA. As BlueScope continues to grow as a business we continue to strengthen our People team by looking to bring new capabilities into the function. Are you passionate about delving into data and uncovering insights and trends? Whether you’re an experienced HR Analyst or looking to transition into the world of data-driven decision making, we have an exciting opportunity for you. Join our team in this newly created role, where you will prepare, design and execute reports that are critical to our business. Your focus will be to extract and transform data from various sources while identifying and developing process improvements. You will receive an attractive remuneration package that includes a 14% superannuation option and an annual profit share plan. You will also enjoy the benefits of flexible and hybrid working arrangements and access to health and wellbeing programs including fitness passports and our EAP provider. What Will You Do? In this analytical role, you will support our high performing People Services team by managing internal requests and supporting the HR function. You will: design and generate accurate and credible HR reports using reporting tools to assist the business make data-driven decisions create and manage data models through Power BI structured to deliver and align with Human Resource requirements analyse trends and provide actionable data insights that make meaningful differences. proactively assess needs of internal customers and develop tools and analytics to help HR best service their business More About You You will have a growth mindset, positive attitude and a strong analytical capability, in addition to: experience in data analytics, business intelligence experience with creating effective dashboards in PowerBI (or similar) effective communication skills a high attention to detail and ability to complete multiple tasks simultaneously a customer centric focus with an ability to liaise with internal teams experience operating in an SAP environment Why BlueScope As BlueScope continues to go from strength to strength, a career with us provides you with the opportunity to grow and be rewarded. At BlueScope, you will: create and deliver innovative solutions that drive transformation in our business make an impact that really does shape the world we live in keep growing through continuous learning and development opportunities enjoy the sense of belonging that comes from working with people who genuinely look out for one another At BlueScope, our people are our strength, and we don’t say that lightly. We want our people to be successful, and to be safe. We offer work-life flexibility through our B-flex program and make sure our inclusive work environment welcomes people of all backgrounds. We’re passionate about driving sustainability outcomes that matter to our communities, including action on climate and our 2050 net zero goal. And we’ll do this through Our Purpose: We create and inspire smart solutions in steel, to strengthen our communities for the future. Come and discover us at bluescope.com/life-at-bluescope/careers. Together we can make a world of difference. Applications close Wednesday 15 November 2023.Show moreReport

Working at Transurban is different; it’s a place where you can see the benefits of your work play out in real life, every day. We create city-sized solutions—building and operating safer, smarter, and more sustainable roads—to solve pressing transport challenges that are slowing cities down. About the role We’re seeking a Senior Business Analyst to develop requirements for end-to-end processes such as billing, invoicing and customer accounts. This role will involve the analysis of initiatives relating to preventative and detective controls, reporting of process improvement and customer remediation programs, as well as the management of financial models for new projects. As our Senior Business Analyst, you’ll contribute to lasting and positive changes that shape the future of our cities and communities. It’s meaningful, challenging and exciting work. Day-to-day, you will: Perform high level feasibility analysis on new problems, gathering relevant data and quickly integrate and analyse information to form logical answers to questions. Investigate inputs regarding potential data inaccuracies. Development and execution of specific use-cases. Run workshops as required to build proactive identification processes.
