Baptcare is a purpose driven organisation working across Victoria, Tasmania, and South Australia. Focused on providing residential and community care for older people and support to children, families, and people with disability, financially disadvantaged people and people seeking asylum.  Our Values are Wellbeing, Ethics, Co-creating, Accountability, Respect and Effectiveness ​. ​  About the Role  The role of IT Senior Business Analyst entails enhancing customer and employee experiences, as well as optimising back-office efficiency. It involves utilising various lean business analysis methods and tools throughout the entire business activity lifecycle. Responsibilities encompass gathering and documenting emerging business requirements, improving business processes, and analysing and reporting data to facilitate operational enhancements. Additionally, this position prioritises identifying and quantifying potential benefits, including financial ones, resulting from these efforts.  Key Duties  Lead documentation, analysis and recommendations for process improvements using lean business analysis methodologies.  Prepare various documents, including requirements, RFPS, RFQs, Tender requests, Policies and Procedures.  Participate in the evaluation of vendors/products against requirements.  Gather and document business requirements while engaging with key stakeholders.  Prioritise and continuously refine requirements, ensuring alignment with organisational goals.  Facilitates collaborative workshops to capture business rules, translating business to technical requirements.  Design and document future business processes, including financial impact assessments.  Identify and recommend improvement to current processes using lean thinking.  Collect, interpret, and analyse data to identify trends, issues and opportunities.  Identify, measure, and monitor benefits including financial scenarios and outcomes.  About You  You are passionate about progressing your career in Information Technology and will ideally bring the following:  Proven experience as a Business Analyst with modern IT environment expertise in applying methodologies and tools for creative business requirements development and re-engineering.  Demonstrated ability to review and enhance business processes using a lean approach, such as Lean Six Sigma.  Proficiency in data modelling, analysis of large datasets, and financial analysis.  Strong understanding of business applications, interfaces, integrated operational environments, solution architecture principles and Enterprise Architecture best practices and principles.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including report and business case writing and facilitating workshops.  Ability to thrive in a dynamic, change-prone environment, self-manage, and solve complex problems.  Strong engagement, negotiation, and influencing skills, especially with senior business stakeholders. Alignment and commitment to Baptcare’s Mission, Vision, and Values  Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Business Analysis, Information Technology or other relevant degree.  Business Analyst experience, preferable in one or more of the following areas: information and communication technology, business administration, service design, process/operations improvement, customer & employee experience management, business strategy/operating models.  A minimum of 7 years related experience.  For You  Baptcare is focused on living our values, not just talking about them. You’ll find the culture at Baptcare is one of genuine respect, support, and positive intention. We work hard to achieve results through change, continuous improvement, and ongoing focus on providing the best service delivery to our stakeholders.  Further, the successful candidate will receive: A competitive salary, plus access to the tax benefits of salary packaging and novated leasing.  Hybrid working arrangements with 3 days in the Camberwell office  Access to confidential counselling and support services.  Be part of an organisation and a team that is driven to make a difference to the lives of our vulnerable community members.  Only short-listed applicants will be contacted.  Applicants must have the right to work in Australia.  The successful applicant will be required to undergo a National Criminal History check.  Must have had or be willing to get COVID vaccination  If you require support with the application process, please contact gvenizelos@baptcare.org.au  Baptcare is committed to building a respectful and inclusive workplace, appointing the best person for the role, and supporting diversity. We welcome applicants who may require adjustments.  Baptcare is dedicated to the safety, empowerment and participation of all children. We have zero tolerance of child abuse and are committed to a thoughtful, protective environment that supports infants, children and young people to feel safe and respected.Show moreReport

job_description: Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options and adaptable hours Competitive salary of up to $130,000 + benefits Play a key role in shaping the future of the wholesale energy market   Our client, a renowned energy retailer, is recognized for its unwavering commitment to innovation and sustainability, and delivering exceptional career opportunities. Collaborating seamlessly with cross-functional teams, including traders, finance, and operations, to ensure efficient risk communication and execution of hedging strategies. Monitoring market developments, regulatory changes, and industry trends to inform risk mitigation strategies and adapt to evolving market conditions. Requirements: The ideal candidate should possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Finance, Economics, or a related field. Proficiency in utilizing advanced analytical tools and software for data analysis and modeling. Strong analytical acumen with the ability to derive actionable insights from complex data sets. Excellent communication and presentation skills, effectively conveying complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. A proven track record of thriving in fast-paced and dynamic environments, effectively managing multiple priorities and meeting deadlines. Benefits: Our client offers a competitive salary of up to $130,000 and a comprehensive benefits package, including health, dental, and vision coverage. Generous vacation and paid time off, supporting a healthy work-life balance. Flexible work arrangements, including the option for remote work or a hybrid model. Professional development opportunities, including training programs and industry conferences. A collaborative and inclusive work environment that values diversity and fosters innovation. Understanding of enterprise–level infrastructure for eCommerce. Data analysis experience or proficiency with data analysis tools. Knowledge of relational and NoSQL databases. PMI certifications, BABOK, or other BA certifications, and TOGAF certification. job_title: Senior Commercial Analyst - Australia's Leading Renewable Energy Company
job_description: Innovative Team: Shape the future of sustainable energy solutions. Strategic Impact: Influence key business decisions with data-driven insights. Industry Leader: Join a prestigious company in the energy sector.   Our client, one of Australia's leading renewable energy companies, is at the forefront of the energy sector, providing reliable and sustainable solutions to power the nation. With a commitment to innovation, excellence, and environmental responsibility, they are dedicated to shaping a greener and more efficient energy landscape for the future. As they continue to expand their operations and drive positive change, they are seeking a talented and experienced Senior Commercial Analyst to join their dynamic team.  The Senior Commercial Analyst will play a pivotal role in supporting and driving the commercial success of the company. Reporting directly to the Head of Energy Markets, the successful candidate will be responsible for analysing complex financial data, identifying opportunities for growth and cost optimisation, and providing strategic insights to key stakeholders.   The role will encompass a wide range of activities, from financial modeling and forecasting to performance analysis and risk assessment, making it an exciting opportunity for an analytical mind seeking to make a significant impact in the energy industry.  Key Responsibilities: Conduct comprehensive financial analysis to assess business performance, identify trends, and recommend strategies for improved profitability. Develop and maintain sophisticated financial models to support budgeting, forecasting, and long-term planning initiatives. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather relevant data and insights, fostering a collaborative approach to problem-solving. Provide actionable insights to senior management, including the CFO and other key stakeholders, to drive informed decision-making. Evaluate investment opportunities, assess potential risks, and propose innovative solutions to enhance business outcomes. Monitor and analyse market trends, regulatory changes, and competitor activities to proactively identify opportunities and challenges. Participate in the development of pricing strategies and contract negotiations, ensuring alignment with business objectives and market dynamics. Prepare and present reports, performance dashboards, and financial summaries to internal and external audiences. Mentor and guide junior analysts, fostering professional growth and knowledge-sharing within the team. Qualifications and Experience: Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. A postgraduate degree or relevant professional certifications would be advantageous. Proven experience (minimum 7 years) as a Commercial Analyst, Financial Analyst, or similar role within the energy sector or a related industry. Strong expertise in financial modeling, data analysis, and forecasting, with a keen eye for detail and accuracy. Advanced proficiency in financial analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL) and data visualization software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI). A track record of successfully supporting strategic decision-making processes with actionable insights and data-driven recommendations. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex financial concepts to both financial and non-financial stakeholders. Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment, adapting quickly to changing priorities. Experience in mentoring and guiding junior team members, fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented work culture. Join an Industry Leader: This is an exceptional opportunity for a talented and motivated Senior Commercial Analyst to join one of Australia's most prominent energy companies.   As part of a passionate and innovative team, the successful candidate will have the chance to contribute to sustainable energy solutions and drive positive change in the industry. With a commitment to employee growth and development, our client offers a supportive and dynamic work environment where creativity and initiative are valued and rewarded.  To Apply:  Apply online or email your resume and cover letter to ivan@darcyweil.com. Alternatively, you can contact Ivan Pignataro directly on 0416 507 856.Show moreReport

job_title: Section Leader - Digital Advisory and Advanced Data & Analytics (ANZ)
job_description: Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.  Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.  Your Impact: At Jacobs, we know that when it comes to a world that’s smarter, more connected and more sustainable, digital solutions are an important thread linking it all together. In our digital advisory work, we’re leveraging innovative technologies and big data analytics to solve the world’s most critical challenges. From shaping the safer cities of tomorrow, to protecting against climate change – we’re combining diverse talents with deep client-application experience and digital intelligence to deliver solutions that connect people and places with the means to work smarter and live better, and make an enduring, positive difference in the world. We have been on a remarkable journey of transformation. Transitioning from being a professional services provider across engineering, design, and construction to becoming a global solutions advisor and provider, with digital capabilities at our core. As our clients navigate digital transformation and growing cyber risks, we have positioned ourselves at the forefront of this growth, adding capabilities, products, and tools to serve a growing set of clients. Due to this extraordinary development, we are seeking an inspirational leader to contribute excellent advisory along with driving operational brilliance for the Digital Advisory and Advanced Data & Analytics (DA/ADA) section across the Australia and New Zealand region. The (DA/ADA) practices are a key platform to transformation and growth to both the Digital Solutions business as well as the broader ANZ organisation, and effective leadership of this group will ensure continued growth of this offering. The successful candidate can be based in any of the offices in the following ANZ locations - Perth, Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Auckland, Wellington, Christchurch. Here’s What You’ll Need: In this role, you will have the fantastic opportunity to lead a high performing team with an established pipeline of work and existing customer relationships. While supporting the Director of Operations, you will lead and develop the Digital Advisory and Advanced Data & Analytics section within the Digital Solutions business in ANZ. Utilising your tertiary qualification/s, and relevant professional services/consulting experience, you will demonstrate your stellar record of accomplishment in building genuine client relationships, contributing to business growth, and showcasing your strategic mindset. In this position, your focus will be on: Nurturing and empowering your team, including coaching and mentoring employees with an aim to support professional development. Exemplifying outstanding guidance and people management skills that seamlessly align with Jacobs’ cultural priorities and values. Providing strategic direction for the (DA/ADA) section, including planning and implementation. Clearly and effectively communicating your vision that aligns with Jacobs’ goals and mission. Staying abreast of industry trends and maintaining a curious mind to drive sound commercial decision making. Jacobs. A world where you can. At Jacobs, we support your personal life and career journeys. From our inclusive employee networks to our positive mental health champions, we're committed to driving a culture of caring where you can be you. With safety and flexibility always top of mind, we've gone beyond traditional ways of working to help you uncover a working arrangement that delivers the flexibility, tools and space to maximise your potential. We're the 2023 winners of the Consult Australia People First Award for our suite of employee benefits that support all our employees in all stages of their personal and professional lives. For the 6th consecutive year, we've been named an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (Australia). In New Zealand, we're a founding member of The Diversity Agenda and are committed to making our industry more inclusive and diverse. In Australia, our Reconciliation journey continues to be a considerable focus across all levels of the Jacobs community as we progress our Innovate level Reconciliation Action Plan (RAP). Our Bronze Employer status in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTI+ inclusion recognises our progress in creating an environment where our Jacobs employees can bring their whole selves to work. We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we're inclusive, we're more connected, and if diverse, we're more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you're pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our eight global Jacobs employee networks centred on driving inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and our Women’s Network – find out more about our Jacobs Employee Networks here. No matter what drives you, you'll discover a way to cultivate, nurture and achieve your goals – all at a single global company. We're an equal opportunity employer and encourage candidates of diverse backgrounds to apply. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are strongly encouraged to apply. Jacobs aims to provide cultural safety at our interviews. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are invited to nominate a cultural representative to participate on the interview panel; please let your recruiter know in your application. Accessibility Please contact the team if you require support or reasonable adjustments regarding our recruitment process (for example, you need the application form in a different format). You may be the right candidate for this or other roles. job_title: Quantitative Research Consultant - World Class Social Research
job_description: This leading full-service social research and evaluation organization is Australia’s foremost provider of social and government research services. They are a beacon for world-class research that empowers decision-makers and deepens our understanding of Australian society. If you are looking for a role where your research will have a real impact, you’ve found it!  Dedicated to using its specialist expertise across social, health, and government services, it offers its clients a full range of survey design, survey data management, statistical consulting, analytical thinking, quantitative, qualitative, and evaluation methodologies. They have an established track record of delivering quality projects to exacting standards and they are acknowledged as a centre for excellence in the provision of social and health research services.  They are currently looking to hire a quantitative research Consultant. They deliver a range of quantitative research solutions for their clients and utilise some of the consultancy's most innovative methodologies. It would suit a researcher who would be excited to run both complex mixed methodology projects and quicker turnaround studies.  What sets this role apart: Impact-driven: The research is purposeful, directly affecting the lives of everyday Australians. Recent projects have tackled critical issues such as workplace sexism, racism, bullying, and community perceptions of disabilities. Diverse scope:Engage in research across all facets of state and federal government including health and well-being, education and training, Australian society, employment, housing, marginalised and vulnerable communities. Project leadership: In a client-facing capacity, you'll assume full ownership of studies, overseeing all stages of Quantitative research projects. This includes proposal development, team supervision, and taking the lead on insights, reporting, and final client deliverables. Continuous growth:They’ll provide you with a clearly articulated career path and the mentoring and support of industry experts, to help get you there. As well as professional membership opportunities and access to a study allowance program. Collaborative and inclusive team: Unashamedly lovely, this is a team of people who thoroughly enjoy working with one another, who turn up for each other, and who take great pride in what they achieve collectively. Flexibility: This is a business that supports its people. Home working for 3 days, office based for 2. Set your working day/hours around your commitments. Get your hours done in 9 days and take the 10thday off!  What you bring to the table: A minimum of 4+ years of market or social research experience. Proficiency in the entire Quantitative research cycle, including project leadership, research design, questionnaire development, survey management, analysis, reporting, and proposal creation. An appreciation for mixed methodology research and different sampling frameworks A sharp eye for detail and exceptional organizational skills to efficiently manage multiple projects, teams, and deadlines Experience in using research software such as Q, SPSS, Microsoft Office, and other relevant tools. Top-notch communication skills and a client-centric mindset ready to foster and manage relationships in a client-facing capacity. A genuine drive to advance your career in social policy research This is a unique opportunity to help deliver research that has a positive impact on contemporary social issues. As a business, they offer their employees a flexible, inclusive, collaborative, and supportive team culture, as well as ongoing career and professional development. So, if you are passionate about social or public policy research and possess the necessary skills and experience to succeed in the role, we invite you to apply today. Our consultants take the time to truly understand your career aims and are dedicated to providing tailored, impartial advice to find you the very best career move. We have access to an unrivalled and exclusive range of job opportunities with trailblazing agencies and blue-chips across Australia, NZ and APAC. Resources Group’s Diversity and Equality Policy determines that we submit applicants to our clients on the basis of merit and ability, regardless of race, colour, age, disability, family responsibilities, gender, marital status, nationality, religious or political views or affiliations, sexual orientation or socio-economic background.Show moreReport

job_title: Energy Markets Analyst (Modeling) - Global Renewable Developer
job_description: Analyze energy markets, develop models, support renewable project developments Assess financial viability and risk profiles of renewable energy projects. Provide market insights to drive informed decision-making & investment strategy  Our client is a renowned global renewable energy developer committed to driving the transition towards a sustainable and low-carbon future. With an unwavering focus on developing and operating renewable energy projects, they aim to contribute to the decarbonization of the world's energy systems.   Their diverse portfolio of wind, solar, and other clean energy assets reflects their dedication to making a positive impact on the environment and creating a sustainable future for generations to come.  The Energy Markets Analyst (Modeling) role offers a unique opportunity to join our client's renewable energy development team. As a talented professional, you will play a pivotal role in supporting their mission by analyzing energy markets and developing robust models. Leveraging your expertise, you will provide valuable insights and contribute to the success of their renewable energy projects on a global scale.  Responsibilities: Conduct thorough analysis of energy markets, including supply and demand dynamics, pricing trends, regulatory frameworks, and policy developments. Develop and maintain sophisticated models to simulate energy market scenarios, taking into account factors such as renewable energy generation, market integration, and grid stability. Utilize modeling tools and techniques to assess the financial viability and risk profiles of potential renewable energy projects. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide accurate and timely market insights, supporting decision-making processes for project development and investment strategies. Stay updated on emerging trends and technologies in the renewable energy industry, ensuring continuous improvement of market analysis methodologies and models. Prepare reports, presentations, and other relevant materials to communicate findings and recommendations to internal stakeholders, external partners, and investors. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as economics, finance, engineering, or a related discipline. A master's degree is preferred. Proven experience in energy markets analysis, modeling, or a related field within the renewable energy industry. Strong proficiency in data analysis, statistical modeling, and forecasting techniques. Advanced skills in using modeling software and tools, such as MATLAB, Python, or similar platforms. Knowledge of renewable energy technologies, grid integration challenges, and energy policy frameworks. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively convey complex concepts to diverse audiences. Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously. NOTE: Please apply with a professional cover letter outlining your skills, knowledge, and experience relating to this opportunity and a current resume. Job Description Immerse yourself in our inclusive, diverse and supportive culture Choose the way you want to work by embracing our flexible work arrangement Collaborate with sector and technical experts to grow your knowledge and network KPMG Australia is part of a global network providing extensive services across a wide range of industries and sectors. Our people collaborate, share their expertise and create innovation as we partner with clients to solve complex challenges, empower change, drive disruption and growth. We look for talented people with the potential to make an extraordinary difference for our clients, our firm and our communities. KPMG’s Technology & Information Risk Management is your opportunity to be part of a team on the rise! Rapidly growing with many competent individuals with various technical backgrounds, the Security Risk team supports business stakeholders in bringing their ideas to life while helping them to shape the future of the firm, by exploring and embedding new forms of growth. Your Opportunity The role of the Information Security Risk Analyst at KPMG contributes to the improvement of the company's information security posture and provides support to various departments within the organisation in several ways: Identifying and Managing Risks: The analyst helps in identifying and managing cyber security and other technology and information risks. This involves performing threat assessments to identify potential risks to the business and determining the preventative controls in place. Enhancing Business Resilience: The analyst contributes to enhancing the organisation's business resilience by designing and implementing effective controls over technology assets. This helps in building the organisation's resilience and strengthening core controls to meet the challenges of technology and information risks. Compliance and Governance: The analyst assists the organisation in meeting its IT compliance and governance obligations in a way that enhances business objectives. This includes developing continuous assurance and monitoring capabilities to optimise the use of resources. In summary, the role of the Information Security Risk Analyst is crucial in maintaining KPMG's information protection agenda as the business and technology programmes evolve, providing greater visibility and understanding of changing risks. Key Duties & Responsibilities: Assess various domains aspects of information security risk for KPMG Australia and develop recommendations for improvement Assess systems/solution/application architecture documents from a cyber security lens Assist and at times lead, in providing information security reporting to local IT leadership, regional and global leadership Assess risks and provide subject matter expertise associated with acquisitions, the onboarding of vendor solutions, technology, and services. Recommend and ensure security controls are proportionate to mitigate threats Lead initiatives to improve the security posture of the firm, increase efficiency and/or new ways to assess emerging technologies (such as AI, blockchain, quantum computing, and more) How are you extraordinary? You actively seek out opportunities for growth, are comfortable challenging the status quo, and enjoy getting out of your comfort zone. You are passionate about the importance of fantastic communication to share ideas, inspire, and create change. You are able to digest, distil, and communicate complex concepts in both written and verbal forms. Your Experience Knowledge in security standards and frameworks, such as ISO27001, NIST 800-53, Cloud Services, Risk Management, Security & Privacy Controls Knowledge of Cloud technologies and architectures (AWS and/or Azure) Knowledge of various application architectures Accreditation in one of the following, CISM, CRISC, CISSP, SABSA or other relevant certifications, such as AWS or Azure cloud technologies would be advantageous Qualifications Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in an information technology or business-related discipline. Additional Information KPMG is a professional services firm with global outreach and deep sector experience. We work with clients across an array of industries to solve complex challenges, steer change and enable growth. Our people are what make KPMG the thriving workplace that it is and what sets us apart is that we know great minds think differently. Collaborate with a team of passionate, highly skilled professionals who’ve got your back. You’ll build relationships with unique and diverse colleagues who will provide you with the support you need to be your best and produce meaningful and impactful work in an inclusive, equitable culture. At KPMG, you’ll take control over how you work. We’re embracing a new way of working in many ways, from offering flexible hours and locations to generous paid parental leave and career breaks. Our people enjoy a variety of exciting perks, including retail discounts, health and wellbeing initiatives, learning and growth opportunities, salary packaging options and more. Diverse candidates have diverse needs. During your recruitment journey, information will be provided about adjustment requests. If you require additional support before submitting your application, please contact the Talent Support Team. At KPMG every career is different, and we look forward to seeing how you grow with us.Show moreReport

About the company:  Our client is a leading and innovative pharmaceutical company dedicated to improving the lives of patients worldwide. Our mission is to develop and deliver high-quality pharmaceutical products that meet the highest standards of safety and efficacy. As part of our commitment to excellence, we are seeking a skilled and motivated Quality Control Analyst to join their team on a 12-month contract basis. This role has the scope to go permanent for the right candidate after the 12 months.  About the role:  As a Quality Control Analyst, you will play a critical role in ensuring the quality and safety of our pharmaceutical products. Your primary responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: Conducting biochemistry assays to test proteins, ensuring accuracy, precision, and compliance with established procedures. Analysing and interpreting data, performing calculations, and documenting results in accordance with industry guidelines and internal protocols. Maintaining and calibrating laboratory equipment, troubleshooting technical issues, and ensuring instruments are in optimal working condition. Contributing to the development and improvement of analytical methods, ensuring they meet regulatory requirements and industry best practices. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including R&D, Manufacturing, and Quality Assurance, to support product development and release. Adhering to Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) to maintain compliance with relevant regulations and quality standards. Assisting in general laboratory housekeeping, including inventory management, reagent preparation, and waste disposal. Documenting all activities accurately and maintaining organised records for future reference and regulatory audits. Participating in regular team meetings, sharing insights, and contributing to a culture of continuous improvement. Skills and experience:  To be successful in this role, you should possess the following qualifications and skills: Bachelor's degree in Biochemistry, Chemistry, or related field. Extensive experience from ideally pathology, or pharmaceuticals. Proven experience in conducting biochemistry assays to test proteins within a pharmaceutical, biotechnology, or related industry. Familiarity with various analytical techniques, including but not limited to capillary electrophoresis, SDS-PAGE, ELISA, and spectroscopy. Strong understanding of GxP principles and regulatory requirements relevant to pharmaceutical quality control. Attention to detail, excellent organisational skills, and the ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment. Proficiency in using laboratory equipment and software for data analysis and documentation. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively convey technical information. How to apply:  Click on the "Apply Now" button with a cover letter addressing the selection criteria above AND a detailed resume in WORD format (PDFs can be corrupted / not processed). Note: Applications only accepted from Australian / NZ residents with valid Australian work rights or temporary residents on work visas e.g. Working Holiday Visa.  Need more information:  Please call Jessica or Cathy on 03 9040 1630  How to Register with Evolve:  For upcoming positions please click on the "Apply Now” button. By applying to any of our roles you will also be registered for future positions unless you request not to be.  Why Evolve Scientific Recruitment?  Evolve is an award winning agency specialising in scientific/technical recruitment in: Pharmaceutical, Food, Biotechnology, Chemical, Petrochemical, Environmental, Health Services, Life Sciences, Mining and  With over 90 years' combined experience, NES Fircroft (NES) is proud to be the world's leading engineering staffing provider spanning the Oil & Gas, Power & Renewables, Chemicals, Construction & Infrastructure, Life Sciences, Mining and Manufacturing sectors worldwide. With more than 80 offices in 45 countries, we are able to provide our clients with the engineering and technical expertise they need, wherever and whenever it is needed. job_title: Techno Functional Accounting Integration Product Analyst
job_description: Job Title: Techno-Functional Accounting Integration Product Analyst (AIPA) 6-12months contract Location: [Melbourne] Are you a dynamic and experienced professional with a solid background in both technical accounting knowledge and a wide array of accounting integration products? Are you passionate about analysing accounting software, identifying limitations, proposing enhancements, and improving workflows within an accounting environment? If so, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity as a Techno-Functional Accounting Integration Product Analyst (AIPA). Key Responsibilities: Leverage technical accounting expertise to analyse and work with a diverse range of accounting integration products. Utilize 3+ years of experience working with integrated accounting apps (e.g., Xero, QBO, MYOB) to design and optimize processes and workflows within an accounting environment. Deconstruct and analyse accounting software products to identify limitations and recommend enhancements and workarounds. Apply strong analytical skills to manipulate and structure data sets for in-depth analysis and reporting purposes. Effectively communicate product analyses and requirements to other product team members in a clear and concise manner. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of accounting products and efficient workflow management. Marsh is seeking candidates for the following position based in either Melbourne, Sydney, Perth and Brisbane: Senior Digital Analyst What can you expect? The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in driving the success of our digital initiatives. They will collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather, analyse, and translate business requirements into actionable insights and solutions that enhance our digital products and services. The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker with a deep understanding of digital trends, user experience, business needs, and possesses extensive knowledge of Property and Casualty (P&C) Insurance. What is in it for you? At Marsh, we recognise that our most important asset is our people. We offer benefits and programs that support career development such as professional development support, exam and study assistance and global rotation opportunities which will support and nurture you with every opportunity to reach your full potential. We also recognise the value of healthy, happy colleagues and promote a culture of care and wellbeing, offering benefits such as flexible working and much more! Flexible work arrangements Professional environment where your career path really matters and is supported in our global organisation Great team environment with supportive colleagues We will count on you to: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document detailed business requirements for digital projects and initiatives. Conduct thorough analysis of business processes, user interactions, and market trends to identify opportunities for digital enhancements. Translate complex business requirements into clear and concise technical specifications and user stories. Work closely with developers, designers, and other team members to ensure successful implementation of digital solutions. Perform data analysis to extract valuable insights that drive informed decision-making. Conduct user acceptance testing to ensure digital solutions meet business needs and quality standards. Monitor and assess the performance of digital products and services, recommending improvements based on data-driven findings. Stay updated on industry best practices, digital trends, and emerging technologies that could impact our digital strategies. Provide mentorship and guidance to junior analysts and team members. From time to time, conduct engaging product demonstrations to both existing and prospective clients. Lead change management efforts related to the adoption of new digital solutions, collaborating with stakeholders to ensure successful integration. Develop and deliver training programs to end-users, enabling them to effectively use and maximize the benefits of digital products. From time to time, engage in calls during odd hours to facilitate collaboration with international teams. What you need to have: Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus. Proven experience (5 years) as a Business Analyst in digital-focused projects. Deep knowledge of Property and Casualty (P&C) Insurance industry practices, products, and processes Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex business requirements into practical solutions. Proficiency in using business analysis tools and methodologies. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Experience with data analysis and visualization tools. Familiarity with agile development methodologies. Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment. Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities. Detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple priorities. Certification in Business Analysis (e.g., CBAP) or related field. Familiarity with UX/UI principles and practices. About us: Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk adviser. With over 45,000 colleagues operating in more than 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the leading global professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of over US $20 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer, and Oliver Wyman. Follow Marsh on Twitter @MarshGlobal; LinkedIn; Facebook; and YouTube. Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person. Note: the changes to our hybrid work policy do not apply to officially designated remote workers and are subject to any works council or local legal requirement. POSITION DESCRIPTION Position Title Senior Research Consultant (Quantitative) Type Full time Division Quantitative Research Supervisor Clare Gelman (Senior Research Manager) Stream Professional stream Location Melbourne (Collingwood office) Start Date ASAP Salary Negotiable depending on skills and experience  Opportunity to transition to a 4 day work week (at 5 days’ pay) How to apply Applications only accepted via ORIMA website  ABOUT ORIMA   ORIMA Research is a private Australian-owned professional services firm that provides market and social research, data analytics, organisational performance improvement and related advisory services. We are a genuine public sector research specialist, whereby over 90% of our clients are in the government sector. Established in 1996, we now have around 60 professional staff working across four offices in Melbourne, Canberra, Sydney and Brisbane. ORIMA is a values-based organisation and we pride ourselves on our service ethos, high  performance culture, innovation, integrity and focus on helping our staff to thrive. We are: People who believe in the value of evidence-based approaches to inform government decision making; Lateral thinkers and problem solvers – we find the best solutions for our clients; and From a diverse range of qualifications and professional backgrounds.  ROLE DESCRIPTION  We are seeking a researcher with experience in quantitative research to support the suite of surveys  we currently offer in the education space, as well as other ad hoc research work. The nature of the  projects requires flexibility in research design, strong problem-solving skills and the ability to quickly  understand client needs and identify how research can be used to address them. We are looking for an experienced quantitative researcher with strong written and communication  skills and solid understanding and application of evidence-based research design and quantitative  methods. The ideal candidate will have an analytical mind, strong attention to detail, high quality  written skills, professional presentation and communication capabilities, and who enjoys working in  a fast-paced environment with five or more years of relevant experience. This role provides the  researcher the opportunity to further develop their quantitative data analysis and client  management skills, as well as do meaningful research. The researcher would work within a small team of highly skilled researchers with a passion for  making a difference to the clients we serve. We are looking for a self-starter who will uphold privacy  and confidentiality in all that they do, and who will contribute to a supportive, positive and engaged  office culture. The role is based in our bright, new Melbourne office in Collingwood.    Updated: September 2023 POSITION DESCRIPTION  KEY DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES Advising clients on optimal research design, project planning and development, execution and reporting, and anticipating all logistical requirements throughout the  course of a project Working closely and collaboratively with our internal IT survey and portal design team to design and create modern data collection solutions Managing internal and external resources and establishing operational processes to ensure resource efficiency and high standards Questionnaire design and, where relevant, incorporating key insights from qualitative research and stakeholder input Analysing and interpreting data (using Q/SPSS/R and Excel), including higher level statistical analysis where required Deducing key findings and overall project ‘narrative’ Communicating research findings clearly and concisely in written, oral and graphical form; using and preparing data visualisation to optimise reports – such as through  infographics and charts Managing projects effectively, including management of contractors i.e. CATI/CAPI, field researchers, subject matter experts; and ensuring projects are managed within  time and budget, and to client expectations Preparing reports in PowerPoint and Word formats to publication standard – including primary drafting and reviewing input from other team members Collaborating on or overseeing projects with team members and staff across the organisation Managing, supporting and training less experienced staff Developing new client leads, preparing proposals and maintaining relationships with existing clients with the view to become their research provider of choice  REQUIREMENTS, QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Residency Status • Open to Residents, PR, Visas with full work eligibility for extended time Qualifications • 5 or more years of relevant work experience Relevant graduate or postgraduate qualification/s - ideally in Commerce, Economics, Marketing, Psychology, Social Science, and / or  Statistics or other relevant degree Relevant strong graduate or postgraduate qualifications Technical Skills • Strong quantitative data analysis skills with ability to translate results  into meaningful findings and recommendations Experience in managing research or consulting projects Competency in Excel and utilisation of statistical packages such as SPSS, R, and/or Q Experience with statistical analysis and statistical methods used in the market and social research industry Strong competency in PowerPoint and Word Understanding of how to explain quantitative data in a way that is accessible and insightful Client management and project management skills and ability to guide, support and mentor other staff Knowledge of, experience or interest in the public sector, government clients and/ or social research Updated: September 2023 POSITION DESCRIPTION General Skills • Very strong attention to detail Strong communication skills – both verbal and written Ability to manage multiple tasks, set priorities, work quickly and accurately, organise work and achieve objectives within timelines and  budget i.e. strong project management skills Able to work in a small team environment and be a genuine team player Self-motivated with a positive mindset, resilience and ‘can do’ attitude; understanding the benefits of a positive attitude on others Ability to work under pressure and in a constructive and helpful manner Motivated to pursue excellence Strong learner with a desire to advance consulting skills and grow in leadership Humble, versatile and prepared to apply self to whatever is required to advance projects and meet client needs. Evidencing a service ethos to  others – externally and internally. Proactive and responsive – thinking ahead in monitoring and guiding projects   HOW TO APPLY Applications will ONLY be accepted via our website. Positive Police check and Working with Vulnerable People checks required. If you have any questions, please email hr@orima.com Applications must include the following: 1. CV  2. Academic records (including transcripts of tertiary qualification/s)  3. Cover letter (of no more than 2 pages) addressing the key job requirements and outlining how well you align with ORIMA’s corporate values. Our selection process involves four stages as follows: Stage 1 – Screening Stage 2 – First round interview Stage 3 – Psychometric testing Stage 4 – Second round interview(s) Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for Stage 1. Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive. At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place. As a Senior Product Insights Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering high quality data analysis and insights to Xero’s Go To Market (GTM) and Strategy teams to enable fast decision making and executing of strategic sales initiatives. With a strong commercial focus, you will be able to frame up the questions to answer, identify critical data points and apply analytical methods to produce insights that tell a clear, concise story to help your internal stakeholders solve problems. Your engagement will span across multiple systems and platforms with specific focus on our Accountants and Bookkeepers channel. We’re looking for someone that can hit the ground running and work with stakeholders across all levels of the business, from Engineers to GTM leaders. You’ll work closely with the existing analysts that support these teams to build a strong data-driven culture in the teams. You will have proven technical and practical skills in the analytics domain and confidently lead analytical initiatives and mentor our eager to learn analysts. We are looking for people with the right capabilities, from diverse backgrounds but importantly also possess a growth mindset. The Product Insights and Analytics team has been a proven development ground for analysts to grow and succeed into greater opportunities. Whether you are hungry to grow your technical capabilities or develop your ability to influence stakeholders and story tell with data, if you have the right aptitude and desire to learn we'll help grow your skillset to truly add value to an organisation. What you'll do... Be a trusted adviser to the Go To Market team, helping them to identify key business questions and finding ways to answer those questions with data.  Define problems and scope solutions for your work, understanding the business context of the work as well as the broader strategic direction of the product and company.  You will get the opportunity to lead initiatives within the Accountants and Bookkeeper division and identify opportunities for strategic work which aligns with our company priorities.  You will understand the flow of data from the product to your analysis, and work to make this data accessible and meaningful. Where gaps in data exist, you will proactively identify approaches for filling these gaps.  Provide leadership in approaches to creating metrics and data models, and produce commercial metrics and models which enable the GTM teams to improve their core understanding of their customers & product, and enhance their decision-making.  Contribute to our library of analytical tools by building tools and processes which are used by other analysts to enhance their work.  Be consulted as an expert on one or more advanced analytical techniques (for example developing A/B testing best-practices or regression toolkits) and coach other analysts on deriving insights from data. What you'll bring... Applied skills Strong business and commercial acumen. Comfortable with fast paced environments and ability to context switch seamlessly between different domains. Flexibility and adaptability to focus on the most important problem in an ever-changing environment. A solid foundation of statistical knowledge with experience in applying statistical techniques to achieve business outcomes (eg. predictive analytics, A/B testing, clustering). Can productively contribute to innovation and problem-solving, and can independently deliver core tasks. Comfortable working with complex data platforms and infrastructures and ability to communicate the complexities to senior leaders. Shows an aptitude to independently learn new skills and technologies, and solve problems. A passion for sharing knowledge, along with mentoring and coaching analysts. Advanced skills with SQL and Python. Skills delivering analytics in the form of visualisations and interactive dashboards. People and Communication Skills Has broad familiarity with Xero's product, our customers, and the data we collect, and deeper knowledge in one or more product areas. Is a confident user of the different platforms and tools we use for accessing data. Strong negotiation and communication skills to influence senior stakeholders and leaders. Positively contributes to team culture. Acts to upskill others in your areas of expertise and can mentor junior staff. Exhibits ownership in stakeholder engagements and is able to build relationships in the organisation. Confident building relationships with stakeholders at all levels of the organisation, to create strong connections and opportunities to collaborate  We know posing a big list like this we’re asking a lot. You do not need to already have this full list of skills and experience to be considered for this role. We want to find the right person to join our team who is passionate about data and developing their skills. You may not match yourself to this full list and that’s okay, we still want to hear from you if you think this is a great next opportunity. We also offer great flexibility, 28 days annual leave, 10 well-being days, a great office environment and career progression. Applications close Friday 24th November. Why Xero? At Xero we support many types of flexible working arrangements that allow you to balance your work, your life and your passions. We offer a great remuneration package including shares plus a range of leave options to suit your well-being. Our work environment encourages continuous improvement and career development and you’ll get to work with the latest technology. Our collaborative and inclusive culture is one we’re immensely proud of. We know that a diverse workforce is a strength that enables businesses, including ours, to better understand and serve customers, attract top talent and innovate successfully. We are a member of Pride in Diversity, in recognition of our inclusive workplace. Our goal is to make sure you feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life. At Xero we embrace diversity and inclusion and value a #challenge mindset. Research has shown that women and underrepresented groups are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single competency or experience . If you are excited about this role, but your past experience doesn't align perfectly, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be just the right person for this role and Xero. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application and throughout the interview process.Show moreReport

job_title: Senior Business Analyst and Change Specialist
job_description: Hi! And thanks for stopping by! We’re MYOB, a business management platform designed to unleash the potential of businesses across Australia and New Zealand! As the #originalstartup, our roots are in finance and accounting software, but today we are so much more. We help our Aussie and Kiwi customers unleash their full potential, giving them the tools to Start, Survive and Succeed: all in the one place. We’re always on the hunt for those who bring a different perspective, diversity of thought and the drive to make our culture even better. Take your career to a new dimension at MYOB. About the Team This is a team that needs no introduction because customers drive our world. Support, Success & Consulting Services represent the voice of our customers and are a highly collaborative conduit between Sales, Tech, Product, and Marketing, ensuring the needs of our SME & Enterprise customers are understood and reflected across the business. The Opportunity We are currently looking for a driven Business Analyst who can use their exceptional analytical and communication skills to collaborate and deliver value to our team. We work hard to achieve best practices and harness emerging trends and are looking for more awesome people to join the MYOB family. The Senior Business Analyst and Change Specialist will work within the Consulting Services Operations Team and will be responsible for activities aimed at improving our processes and systems to ensure the Consulting Services team operates at a high level of efficiency. The successful applicant will gather information, map processes, develop enablement material, update our Confluence site and work collaboratively within our team and cross-functionally.  The role will evolve with changing business needs, however, the initial focus will include:Analyse existing systems, processes, and work practices to identify inefficiencies and recommend improvements.Triage new improvement requirements and manage prioritisation of initiatives considering effort and impact.Facilitate requirements gathering workshops and develop documentation to support initiatives.Document and map sophisticated processes and workflows.Develop change management programs to help adopt and embed changes.Develop enablement material to support training requirements.Update and maintain Consulting Services Information Hub and Workspace (via Atlassian Confluence).Develop test cases for new business processes and system improvements.Research new technological improvements for optimising the delivery of consulting services. What you will bring: You are a driven, self-motivated, resourceful, naturally curious individual who uses a creative mindset to tackle problems and help achieve excellence consistently. You have outstanding skills in crafting business processes. You enjoy gaining and sharing information and are comfortable with change. Knowledge, Experience and Qualifications:Proven experience as a senior business analyst preferably in consulting services.Experience driving system and process change.Strong analytical, and problem-solving skills and ability to interpret operational requirements.Advanced knowledge and experience developing process maps and data flows using business and data process mapping tools such as MS Visio, Lucidchart, Miro or others.Advanced knowledge and experience using Atlassian Confluence.Knowledge of Adult Learning Theories and Principles.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Strong presentation, facilitation and workshop skills.Ability to prioritise rapidly shifting priorities effectively. Our Culture & Benefits Our values have stood the test of time. If you want to work and collaborate where opinions are valued, and your ideas can make a difference, come to a place where Your Work Matters.  See what it's like to work at MYOB and what we're all about.  Do your best work in a flexible work environment, right down to financial assistance to set up your home office…it’s called Flexperience, and it’s designed by you and your team!  Our partnership with Smiling Mind helps support the wellbeing of our team members and customers  Drive your own learning via conferences, in-house training, LinkedIn Learning, study assistance and a strong focus on leaders creating a learning environment  A multitude of leave options including up to an additional four weeks of purchased leave, generous parental leave, domestic violence leave, transgender leave, volunteer leave, study leave, plus more!  Communities built around ‘Wellness’, ‘Belonging’ and the ‘Planet’ where you can make a meaningful contribution  Access to best-in-class discounts and vouchers from leading retailers, and a lot more. We are proud to be a Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to responding to every applicant. MYOB are an equal opportunity employer and we champion diversity. Don’t meet every single requirement of this role? Still apply! Research tells us that that women and underrepresented groups are less likely to apply unless they meet every single requirement. At MYOB we believe that the right hire is someone who makes an addition to our culture, rather than someone who fits in and conforms to our status quo. Moving to ‘Culture Add’ means adding team members who not only value MYOBs standards and workplace culture, but also bring an aspect of diversity that positively contributes to MYOB. So, if you’re excited about this role, or about MYOB, we’d still love to hear from you!Show moreReport

job_title: Senior Technical Business Analyst / Scrum Master
job_description: Our Solution Demyst is a data management company specialising in external data orchestration, helping leading global financial institutions support their business users with data access at scale within their centralized data platforms. In response to growing demand, we’re seeking new team members to help us scale. By joining our team, you will play a crucial role in transforming the way enterprises access external data. Demyst offers a standard configurable interface connecting external data ecosystems to centralized data platforms. We provide the necessary products, support team, and maintenance for production-ready, customized external data pipelines. Our pipelines include configured data, metadata, robust batch and real-time delivery, and ongoing support for optimal performance. Additionally, we offer a streamlined diligence, procurement, and data delivery service for evaluating new data, ensuring efficient decision-making based on agreed standards. Don't miss out on the opportunity to play a vital role in revolutionizing data management for enterprises. The Challenge We are looking for a Senior Technical Business Analyst / Scrum Master to join Demyst. In this role, you will be a member of a global team supporting a distributed system providing highly available, real-time data for critical industry applications around the world. You will partner with both strategic clients and Demyst stakeholders to support the full client lifecycle from pre-sales scoping, requirements gathering, data analysis and modelling, client stakeholder management, internal resource project management, testing, delivery, and support. As a Senior Technical BA, you will lead the delivery of core platform solutions supporting clients globally. This role is hybrid of remote and attendance to some client on-site meetings in Melbourne is required.  Responsibilities Research and analyze business needs, translating them into technical requirements Design and position solutions to deliver value to stakeholders Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement technical solutions aligned with business goals Manage project plans, budgets, and timelines for successful delivery Oversee development, testing, and validation of technical solutions Identify and mitigate project risks, developing contingency plans Communicate technical concepts to stakeholders, including senior leadership. Organise and facilitate agile ceremonies as required by team Create, maintain, and execute JIRA plans to support delivery Lead testing and triaging of issues related to the delivered solution raised by the client and internal team Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies Provide leadership and mentorship to junior team members, including identifying training and development opportunities Elicit requirements by interacting with stakeholders (client and internal), identify opportunities for improvement, and translate requirements into designs Provide guidance to peers, mentoring, and leading others in complex problem solving Other duties as required Requirements Degree in IT, Computer Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, or a related field Experience in data science and data-centric solutions Significant experience developing requirements and product specifications for new or existing applications, integrations, or solutions 5 or more years of experience as a BA with a technical focus Exceptional knowledge of usability, application, and operational performance considerations Forward-thinking communication skills to assist with the development of documentation for software solutions Impressive interpersonal skills to work with and contribute to a team environment Technical background and skillset to translate requirements and project manage Contract Type: Permanent Location: Melbourne CBD & Inner Suburbs Industry: Information and Communication Technology Contact Name: Elton Kelly Contact Email: elton.kelly@naturalselectiongroup.com.au Date Published: 14-Sep-2023 Reporting to the Chief Information Officer, this newly created role is responsible for leading the organisation's data-driven decision-making process by providing insightful business analysis, leveraging advanced analytics, and overseeing the development of actionable business intelligence. Data Visualization: Champion the use of data visualization techniques to present complex analytical findings in a clear and compelling manner. Tertiary qualified, you are a well-rounded and impressive data practitioner with a proven track record of Management in Data, Analytics, and Insights. job_title: Senior Product Insights Analyst - 12 month fixed contract
job_description: Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive. At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place. As a Senior Product Insights Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering high quality data analysis and insights to enable fast decision making and assist in the strategic design of products. You will be able to frame up the questions to answer, identify critical data points and apply analytical methods to produce insights which tell a clear, concise story to help your internal stakeholders solve problems. Your analysis will span our end-to-end customer journeys, across multiple systems, platforms and channels. We’re looking for someone that can hit the ground running and work with stakeholders across all levels of the business, from developers to leaders. You’ll work closely with the existing analysts that support these teams to build a strong data-driven culture in the teams. You will have proven technical and practical skills in the analytics domain and confidently lead analytical initiatives and mentor our eager to learn analysts. What you'll do... Be a trusted adviser to a product team or portfolio area, helping them to identify key business questions and finding ways to answer those questions with data. Define problems and scope solutions for your work, understanding the business context of the work as well as the broader strategic direction of the product and company. You will get the opportunity to lead initiatives that span multiple portfolios, and identify opportunities for strategic work which aligns with our company priorities. Proactively collaborate on cross-portfolio activities that further our business objectives and influence the prioritisation of strategic-level initiatives. You will understand the flow of data from the product to your analysis, and work to make this data accessible and meaningful. Where gaps in data exist, you will proactively identify approaches for filling these gaps. Provide leadership in approaches to creating metrics and data models, and produce metrics and models which enable a portfolio to improve their core understanding of their customers & product, and enhance their decision-making. Contribute to our library of analytical tools by building tools and processes which are used by other analysts to enhance their work. Draw on both specialist and generalist knowledge to derive insights from data. Research and apply techniques from the wider analytics discipline as required, including a range of advanced statistical techniques. Be consulted as an expert on one or more advanced analytical techniques (for example developing A/B testing best-practices or regression toolkits) and coach other analysts on deriving insights from data. What you'll bring... Applied skills Advanced skills with SQL and applied experience, R or Python. A solid foundation of statistical knowledge with experience in applying statistical techniques to achieve business outcomes (eg. predictive analytics, A/B testing, clustering). Can productively contribute to innovation and problem-solving, and can independently deliver core tasks. Shows an aptitude to independently learn new skills and technologies, and solve problems.A passion for sharing knowledge, along with mentoring and coaching analysts. Skills delivering analytics in the form of visualisations and interactive dashboards. Familiarity with modern business intelligence software. Proficiency in Google Analytics, Firebase, BigQuery or Mixpanel is a plus. People and Communication Skills Has broad familiarity with Xero's product, our customers, and the data we collect, and deeper knowledge in one or more product areas. Is a confident user of the different platforms and tools we use for accessing data. Positively contributes to team culture. Acts to upskill others in your areas of expertise and can mentor junior staff. Can apply organisational strategy to your own work, and has a strong commercial mindset. Exhibits ownership in stakeholder engagements and is able to build relationships in the organisation. Can handle context switching and prioritisation in consultation with others. Confident building relationships with stakeholders at all levels of the organisation, to create strong connections and opportunities to collaborate. We are not looking for a specific degree, we’re looking for a logical thinker who can break down a problem, but you may have a statistics, mathematics or computer science background  We know posing a big list like this we’re asking a lot. You do not need to already have this full list of skills and experience to be considered for this role. We want to find the right person to join our team who is passionate about data and developing their skills. You may not match yourself to this full list and that’s okay, we still want to hear from you if you think this is a great next opportunity. We also offer great flexibility, 28 days annual leave, 10 well-being days, a great office environment and career progression. Applications close Friday 24th November. Why Xero? At Xero we support many types of flexible working arrangements that allow you to balance your work, your life and your passions. We offer a great remuneration package including shares plus a range of leave options to suit your well-being. Our work environment encourages continuous improvement and career development and you’ll get to work with the latest technology. Our collaborative and inclusive culture is one we’re immensely proud of. We know that a diverse workforce is a strength that enables businesses, including ours, to better understand and serve customers, attract top talent and innovate successfully. We are a member of Pride in Diversity, in recognition of our inclusive workplace. Our goal is to make sure you feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life. At Xero we embrace diversity and inclusion and value a #challenge mindset. Research has shown that women and underrepresented groups are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single competency or experience . If you are excited about this role, but your past experience doesn't align perfectly, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be just the right person for this role and Xero. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application and throughout the interview process.Show moreReport

Location Melbourne, Victoria Category Office Support Salary $60.26 AUD - $60.26 AUD Hourly Posted 26-Sep-2023 Work type Casual/Temp Contact Claudia Leiva Reference BH-151774 About the Organization:  This leading Federal government agency supports Australian’s in achieving their goals and helps them to live a better life. Their work has an impact on a significant area in the social sector, and you can contribute to the difference that they make in this role. This agency is known for having a great culture across different teams and have excellent office location in Melbourne or Geelong.  About the role:  The APS6 Policy Analyst, Pricing Policy will be responsible for the Agency’s market stewardship to create an efficient and sustainable consumer driven marketplace for disability supports. It regulates the commercial relationships between providers and participants, including through price regulation. The pricing arrangements aim for a balance between participants receiving value for money quality care while improving market supply of providers, as well as recognising the need for financial sustainability.  Responsibilities may include but are not limited to: Strong writing skills to clearly articulate how the policy decisions are supported based on the quantitative and qualitative findings for reports and papers. There will be a separate data team who will be doing the data extraction/analysis using SAS. This candidate should be able to work with the team to define what is required as well as able to understand the output and how it justifies the final policy decisions. As well as the ability to communicate the analysis and how it links to the final decisions in writing and verbally. Qualitative research of economic environment, stakeholder feedback and other relevant policy impact to inform policy decisions. Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to maintain strong, productive working relationships.  Skills and Personal Attributes    Leadership  Highly developed strategic thinking including vision, perception and evaluation skills and the ability to assess impacts, governance and compliance. Ability to develop, implement and communicate the strategic direction of the work area. Lead and manage the team to ensure delivery of work priorities on time and to the expected standards, building team capability and positive work culture. Ability to work effectively autonomously as well as part of a team.  Analytical  Provide direction regarding analysis, research and recommendations for pricing and costing policy reports. Strong analytical skills and the ability to synthesise and coordinate complex information to form decisions that are evidence based and withstand the scrutiny of a range of different stakeholders.  Stakeholder management  Ability to negotiate effectively by listening to differing views to develop a clear understanding of the issues, and to present persuasive responses. Ability to preempt various stakeholder expectations and potential concerns, as well as developing strategies to mitigate such concerns.  Communication  Ability to communicate complex and sensitive issues to influence decision-makers in writing including board papers, working group papers, executive brief and project reports, as well as verbally with working groups, senior management and staff. Ability to clearly articulate evidence-based pricing decisions for NDIS participants, providers and the disability sector in writing through the Annual Pricing Review report as well as verbally with internal and external stakeholders. Coordinating and providing expert advice to senior stakeholders and external bodies.  Technical  Demonstrated understanding of the role of the Agency and how pricing policy contributes to the organisational goals.  MANDATORY  Experience working in a similar role under Australian rules and regulations Excellent written and oral communication skills, and proficiency in the use of IT systems including Microsoft Office Demonstrated commitment to ongoing professional development Current Police Check, o ability to obtain one  DESIRABLE  Previous writing experience in Government Agencies. Understanding of basic economics and the impact of pricing in terms of economic impact. Knowledge or experience of using quantitative and qualitative data to inform policy.  What you will bring to the role:  Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Experience in building relationships both with internal and external stakeholders. Ability to work within and across teams, the ability to adapt quickly to a changing environment Ability to manage confidential and sensitive information. Ability to prioritise and allocate tasks in an efficient manner while also maintaining high work standards and accuracy.  How to apply:   Chandler Macleod is an equal opportunity employer as part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, disability and culturally and linguistics candidates are also encouraged to apply.  Mandatory: Australian Citizenship required to work within Federal Government.  You can also send in your resumes directly to Claudia Leiva at claudia.leiva@chandlermacleod.com to be considered for this opportunity.   Applications close 15.00 PM AEST, 6TH October 2023Show moreReport
